◆ monster() [2/5]

monster::monster ( const mtype_id &  id)
explicit

Definition at line 288 of file monster.cpp.

288  : monster()
289 {
290  type = &id.obj();
291  moves = type->speed;
292  Creature::set_speed_base( type->speed );
293  hp = type->hp;
294  for( const auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {
295  mon_special_attack &entry = special_attacks[sa.first];
296  entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );
297  }
298  anger = type->agro;
299  morale = type->morale;
300  stomach_size = type->stomach_size;
301  faction = type->default_faction;
302  upgrades = type->upgrades && ( type->half_life || type->age_grow );
303  reproduces = type->reproduces && type->baby_timer && !monster::has_flag( mon_flag_NO_BREED );
304  biosignatures = type->biosignatures;
305  if( monster::has_flag( mon_flag_AQUATIC ) ) {
306  fish_population = dice( 1, 20 );
307  }
308  if( monster::has_flag( mon_flag_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
309  itype_id mech_bat = itype_id( type->mech_battery );
310  const itype &type = *item::find_type( mech_bat );
311  int max_charge = type.magazine->capacity;
312  item mech_bat_item = item( mech_bat, calendar::turn_zero );
313  mech_bat_item.ammo_consume( rng( 0, max_charge ), tripoint_zero, nullptr );
314  battery_item = cata::make_value<item>( mech_bat_item );
315  }
316  if( monster::has_flag( mon_flag_PET_MOUNTABLE ) ) {
317  if( !type->mount_items.tied.is_empty() ) {
318  itype_id tied_item_id = itype_id( type->mount_items.tied );
319  item tied_item_item = item( tied_item_id, calendar::turn_zero );
320  add_effect( effect_leashed, 1_turns, true );
321  tied_item = cata::make_value<item>( tied_item_item );
322  }
323  if( !type->mount_items.tack.is_empty() ) {
324  itype_id tack_item_id = itype_id( type->mount_items.tack );
325  item tack_item_item = item( tack_item_id, calendar::turn_zero );
326  add_effect( effect_monster_saddled, 1_turns, true );
327  tack_item = cata::make_value<item>( tack_item_item );
328  }
329  if( !type->mount_items.armor.is_empty() ) {
330  itype_id armor_item_id = itype_id( type->mount_items.armor );
331  item armor_item_item = item( armor_item_id, calendar::turn_zero );
332  add_effect( effect_monster_armor, 1_turns, true );
333  armor_item = cata::make_value<item>( armor_item_item );
334  }
335  if( !type->mount_items.storage.is_empty() ) {
336  itype_id storage_item_id = itype_id( type->mount_items.storage );
337  item storage_item_item = item( storage_item_id, calendar::turn_zero );
338  add_effect( effect_has_bag, 1_turns, true );
339  tack_item = cata::make_value<item>( storage_item_item );
340  }
341  }
342  aggro_character = type->aggro_character;
343 }

480  if( mon_plan.angers_cub_threatened < 0 ) {
481  // return early, not angered by cubs being threatened
482  return;
483  }
484 
485  for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
486  if( type->baby_monster == tmp.type->id ) {
487  // baby nearby; is the player too close?
488  mon_plan.dist = tmp.rate_target( *mon_plan.target, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
489  if( mon_plan.dist <= 3 ) {
490  //proximity to baby; monster gets furious and less likely to flee
491  anger += mon_plan.angers_cub_threatened;
492  morale += mon_plan.angers_cub_threatened / 2;
493  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s's character aggro triggered by threatening %s", name(),
494  tmp.name() );
495  aggro_character = true;
496  }
497  }
498  }
499 }

◆ attack_at()

bool monster::attack_at ( const tripoint &  p)

Attack any enemies at the given location.

Attacks only if there is a creature at the given location towards we are hostile.

Returns
true if something was attacked, false otherwise

Definition at line 1778 of file monmove.cpp.

1779 {
1780  if( has_flag( mon_flag_PACIFIST ) ) {
1781  return false;
1782  }
1783 
1784  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1785  const bool sees_player = sees( player_character );
1786  // Targeting player location
1787  if( p == player_character.pos() ) {
1788  if( sees_player ) {
1789  return melee_attack( player_character );
1790  } else {
1791  // Creature stumbles into a player it cannot see, briefly becoming aware of their location
1792  return stumble_invis( player_character );
1793  }
1794  }
1795 
1796  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
1797  if( monster *mon_ = creatures.creature_at<monster>( p, is_hallucination() ) ) {
1798  monster &mon = *mon_;
1799 
1800  // Don't attack yourself.
1801  if( &mon == this ) {
1802  return false;
1803  }
1804 
1805  // With no melee dice, we can't attack, but we had to process until here
1806  // because hallucinations require no melee dice to destroy.
1807  if( type->melee_dice <= 0 ) {
1808  return false;
1809  }
1810 
1811  Creature::Attitude attitude = attitude_to( mon );
1812  // mon_flag_ATTACKMON == hulk behavior, whack everything in your way
1813  if( attitude == Attitude::HOSTILE || has_flag( mon_flag_ATTACKMON ) ) {
1814  return melee_attack( mon );
1815  }
1816 
1817  return false;
1818  }
1819 
1820  npc *const guy = creatures.creature_at<npc>( p, is_hallucination() );
1821  if( guy && type->melee_dice > 0 ) {
1822  // For now we're always attacking NPCs that are getting into our
1823  // way. This is consistent with how it worked previously, but
1824  // later on not hitting allied NPCs would be cool.
1825  guy->on_attacked( *this ); // allow NPC hallucination to be one shot by monsters
1826  return melee_attack( *guy );
1827  }
1828 
1829  // Attack last known position despite empty
1830  if( has_effect( effect_stumbled_into_invisible ) &&
1831  get_map().has_field_at( p, field_fd_last_known ) && !sees_player &&
1832  attitude_to( player_character ) == Attitude::HOSTILE ) {
1833  return attack_air( p );
1834  }
1835 
1836  // Nothing to attack.
1837  return false;
1838 }

1502  // portal storm creatures ignore NPCs no matter what with this mod on
1503  return MATT_FPASSIVE;
1504  }
1505

1507  if( has_effect( effect_docile ) ) {
1508  return MATT_FPASSIVE;
1509  }
1510  if( u != nullptr ) {
1511  if( u->is_avatar() ) {
1512  return MATT_FRIEND;
1513  }

1515  // Zombies don't understand not attacking NPCs, but dogs and bots should.

1522  }
1523  }
1524  }

1527  }

1537  effective_anger -= 10;
1538  }
1539  }

1551  type->in_species( species_MAMMAL ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_MAMMAL ) ) {
1552  effective_anger -= 20;
1553  }
1554 
1555  if( effective_anger >= 10 &&
1556  type->in_species( species_AMPHIBIAN ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_AMPHIBIAN ) ) {
1557  effective_anger -= 20;
1558  }
1559

1561  faction == monfaction_wasp ) && effective_anger >= 10 && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_INSECT ) ) {
1562  effective_anger -= 20;
1563  }
1564

1566  effective_morale -= 10;
1567  }
1568

1571  effective_anger -= 10;
1572  if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1573  effective_morale += 55;
1574  }
1575  }

1577  effective_anger -= 10;

1579  effective_morale += 55;
1580  }
1581  } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALEMPATH2 ) ) {
1582  effective_anger -= 20;
1583  if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1584  effective_morale += 80;
1585  }
1586  } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD ) ) {
1587  if( effective_anger >= 10 ) {
1588  effective_anger += 10;
1589  }
1590  if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1591  effective_morale -= 5;
1592  }
1593  } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD2 ) ) {
1594  if( effective_anger >= 20 ) {
1595  effective_anger += 20;
1596  }
1597  if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1598  effective_morale -= 5;
1599  }
1600  }
1601  }
1602 
1603  for( const trait_id &mut : u->get_mutations() ) {
1604  const mutation_branch &branch = *mut;
1605  if( branch.ignored_by.empty() && branch.anger_relations.empty() ) {
1606  continue;
1607  }
1608  for( const species_id &spe : branch.ignored_by ) {
1609  if( type->in_species( spe ) ) {
1610  return MATT_IGNORE;
1611  }
1612  }
1613  for( const std::pair<const species_id, int> &elem : branch.anger_relations ) {
1614  if( type->in_species( elem.first ) ) {
1615  effective_anger += elem.second;
1616  }
1617  }
1618  }
1619  }
1620 
1621  if( effective_morale < 0 ) {
1622  if( effective_morale + effective_anger > 0 && get_hp() > get_hp_max() / 3 ) {
1623  return MATT_FOLLOW;
1624  }
1625  return MATT_FLEE;
1626  }
1627 
1628  if( effective_anger <= 0 ) {
1629  if( get_hp() <= 0.6 * get_hp_max() ) {
1630  return MATT_FLEE;
1631  } else {
1632  return MATT_IGNORE;
1633  }
1634  }
1635 
1636  if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1637  return MATT_FOLLOW;
1638  }
1639

1641  rl_dist( get_location(), get_dest() ) < type->tracking_distance ) {
1642  return MATT_FLEE;
1643  }
1644 
1645  if( u != nullptr && !aggro_character && !u->is_monster() ) {
1646  return MATT_IGNORE;
1647  }
1648 
1649  return MATT_ATTACK;
1650 }

◆ attitude_to()

Creature::Attitude monster::attitude_to ( const Creature &  other) const
overridevirtual

Attitude (of this creature) towards another creature.

This might not be symmetric.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1450 of file monster.cpp.

1451 {
1452  const monster *m = other.is_monster() ? static_cast< const monster *>( &other ) : nullptr;
1453  const Character *p = other.as_character();
1454  if( m != nullptr ) {
1455  if( m == this ) {
1456  return Attitude::FRIENDLY;
1457  }
1458 
1459  mf_attitude faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( m->faction );
1460  if( ( friendly != 0 && m->friendly != 0 ) ||
1461  ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) ) {
1462  // Friendly (to player) monsters are friendly to each other
1463  // Unfriendly monsters go by faction attitude
1464  return Attitude::FRIENDLY;
1465  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(bugprone-branch-clone)
1466  } else if( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_HATE ) {
1467  // Stuff that hates a specific faction will always attack that faction
1468  return Attitude::HOSTILE;
1469  } else if( ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL ) ||
1470  morale < 0 || anger < 10 ) {
1471  // Stuff that won't attack is neutral to everything
1472  return Attitude::NEUTRAL;
1473  } else {
1474  return Attitude::HOSTILE;
1475  }
1476  } else if( p != nullptr ) {
1477  switch( attitude( p ) ) {
1478  case MATT_FRIEND:
1479  return Attitude::FRIENDLY;
1480  case MATT_FPASSIVE:
1481  case MATT_FLEE:
1482  case MATT_IGNORE:
1483  case MATT_FOLLOW:
1484  return Attitude::NEUTRAL;
1485  case MATT_ATTACK:
1486  return Attitude::HOSTILE;
1487  case MATT_NULL:
1488  case NUM_MONSTER_ATTITUDES:
1489  break;
1490  }
1491  }
1492  // Should not happen!, creature should be either player or monster
1493  return Attitude::NEUTRAL;
1494 }

1576 {
1577  int movecost = 0;
1578 
1579  map &here = get_map();
1580  const int source_cost = here.move_cost( f );
1581  const int dest_cost = here.move_cost( t );
1582  // Digging and flying monsters ignore terrain cost
1583  if( flies() || ( digging() && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DIGGABLE, t ) ) ) {
1584  movecost = 100;
1585  // Swimming monsters move super fast in water
1586  } else if( swims() ) {
1587  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, f ) ) {
1588  movecost += 25;
1589  } else {
1590  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( f );
1591  }
1592  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, t ) ) {
1593  movecost += 25;
1594  } else {
1595  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( t );
1596  }
1597  } else if( can_submerge() ) {
1598  // No-breathe monsters have to walk underwater slowly
1599  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, f ) ) {
1600  movecost += 250;
1601  } else {
1602  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( f );
1603  }
1604  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, t ) ) {
1605  movecost += 250;
1606  } else {
1607  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( t );
1608  }
1609  movecost /= 2;
1610  } else if( climbs() ) {
1611  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, f ) ) {
1612  movecost += 150;
1613  } else {
1614  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( f );
1615  }
1616  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, t ) ) {
1617  movecost += 150;
1618  } else {
1619  movecost += 50 * here.move_cost( t );
1620  }
1621  movecost /= 2;
1622  } else {
1623  movecost = ( ( 50 * source_cost ) + ( 50 * dest_cost ) ) / 2.0;
1624  }
1625 
1626  return movecost;
1627 }

◆ can_move_to()

bool monster::can_move_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Checks whether we can move to/through p.

This does not account for bashing.

This is used in pathfinding and ONLY checks the terrain. It ignores players and monsters, which might only block this tile temporarily. will_move_to() checks for impassable terrain etc can_reach_to() checks for z-level difference. can_move_to() is a wrapper for both of them. know_danger_at() checks for fire, trap etc. (flag PATH_AVOID_)

Definition at line 356 of file monmove.cpp.

357 {
358  return can_reach_to( p ) && will_move_to( p );
359 }
monster::can_reach_to
bool can_reach_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:330
monster::will_move_to
bool will_move_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:193

References can_reach_to(), and will_move_to().

Referenced by bash_at(), melee_actor::do_grab(), get_path_avoid(), move(), move_to(), push_to(), scent_move(), map::spawn_monsters_submap(), map::spawn_monsters_submap_group(), and stumble().

◆ can_reach_to()

bool monster::can_reach_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 330 of file monmove.cpp.

331 {
332  map &here = get_map();
333  if( p.z > pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
334  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_UP, tripoint( p.xy(), p.z - 1 ) ) ) {
335  return true;
336  }

341  } else if( p.z < pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
342  const tripoint above( p.xy(), p.z + 1 );
343  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, above ) ) {
344  return true;
345  }
346  if( !here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) &&
347  ( here.has_floor( above ) || ( !flies() && !here.has_floor_or_water( above ) ) ) ) {
348  // can't go through the floor
349  // Check floors for flying monsters movement
350  return false;
351  }
352  }
353  return true;
354 }

◆ die()

void monster::die ( Creature *  killer)
overridevirtual

Empty function.

Should always be overwritten by the appropriate player/NPC/monster version.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 2742 of file monster.cpp.

2743 {
2744  if( dead ) {
2745  // We are already dead, don't die again, note that monster::dead is
2746  // *only* set to true in this function!
2747  return;
2748  }
2749  // We were carrying a creature, deposit the rider
2750  if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && mounted_player ) {
2751  mounted_player->forced_dismount();
2752  }
2753  g->set_critter_died();
2754  dead = true;
2755  set_killer( nkiller );
2756  if( get_killer() != nullptr ) {
2757  Character *ch = get_killer()->as_character();
2758  if( ch == nullptr && get_killer()->get_summoner() != nullptr ) {
2759  ch = get_killer()->get_summoner()->as_character();
2760  }
2761  if( !is_hallucination() && ch != nullptr ) {
2762  cata::event e = cata::event::make<event_type::character_kills_monster>( ch->getID(), type->id,
2763  compute_kill_xp( type->id ) );
2764  get_event_bus().send_with_talker( ch, this, e );
2765  if( ch->is_avatar() && ch->has_trait( trait_KILLER ) ) {
2766  if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
2767  const translation snip = SNIPPET.random_from_category( "killer_on_kill" ).value_or( translation() );
2768  ch->add_msg_if_player( m_good, "%s", snip );
2769  }
2770  ch->add_morale( MORALE_KILLER_HAS_KILLED, 5, 10, 6_hours, 4_hours );
2771  ch->rem_morale( MORALE_KILLER_NEED_TO_KILL );
2772  }
2773  }
2774  }
2775  map &here = get_map();
2776  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
2777  if( has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB_FILTER ) ) {
2778  // Need to filter out which limb we were grabbing before death
2779  for( const tripoint &player_pos : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 ) ) {
2780  Creature *you = creatures.creature_at( player_pos );
2781  if( !you || !you->has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {
2782  continue;
2783  }
2784  // ...but if there are no grabbers around we can just skip to the end
2785  bool grabbed = false;
2786  for( const tripoint &mon_pos : here.points_in_radius( player_pos, 1, 0 ) ) {
2787  const monster *const mon = creatures.creature_at<monster>( mon_pos );
2788  // No persisting our grabs from beyond the grave, but we also don't get to remove the effect early
2789  if( mon && mon->has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB_FILTER ) && mon != this ) {
2790  grabbed = true;
2791  break;
2792  }
2793  }
2794  if( !grabbed ) {
2795  you->add_msg_player_or_npc( m_good, _( "The last enemy holding you collapses!" ),
2796  _( "The last enemy holding <npcname> collapses!" ) );
2797  // A loop for safety
2798  for( const effect &grab : you->get_effects_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {
2799  you->remove_effect( grab.get_id() );
2800  }
2801  continue;
2802  }
2803  // Iterate through all your grabs to figure out which one this critter held
2804  for( const effect &grab : you->get_effects_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {
2805  if( is_grabbing( grab.get_bp().id() ) ) {
2806  const effect_type effid = *grab.get_effect_type();
2807  you->remove_effect( effid.id, grab.get_bp() );
2808  }
2809  }
2810  }
2811  }
2812 
2813  // If we're a queen, make nearby groups of our type start to die out
2814  if( !is_hallucination() && has_flag( mon_flag_QUEEN ) ) {
2815  // The submap coordinates of this monster, monster groups coordinates are
2816  // submap coordinates.
2817  const tripoint abssub = ms_to_sm_copy( here.getabs( pos() ) );
2818  // Do it for overmap above/below too
2819  for( const tripoint &p : points_in_radius( abssub, HALF_MAPSIZE, 1 ) ) {
2820  // TODO: fix point types
2821  for( mongroup *&mgp : overmap_buffer.groups_at( tripoint_abs_sm( p ) ) ) {
2822  if( MonsterGroupManager::IsMonsterInGroup( mgp->type, type->id ) ) {
2823  mgp->dying = true;
2824  }
2825  }
2826  }
2827  }
2828  mission::on_creature_death( *this );
2829 
2830  // Hallucinations always just disappear
2831  if( is_hallucination() ) {
2832  mdeath::disappear( *this );
2833  return;
2834  }
2835 
2836  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, m_good, type->mdeath_effect.death_message.translated(), name() );
2837 
2838  if( type->mdeath_effect.has_effect ) {
2839  //Not a hallucination, go process the death effects.
2840  spell death_spell = type->mdeath_effect.sp.get_spell( *this );
2841  if( killer != nullptr && !type->mdeath_effect.sp.self &&
2842  death_spell.is_target_in_range( *this, killer->pos() ) ) {
2843  death_spell.cast_all_effects( *this, killer->pos() );
2844  } else if( type->mdeath_effect.sp.self ) {
2845  death_spell.cast_all_effects( *this, pos() );
2846  }
2847  }
2848 
2849  if( type->mdeath_effect.eoc.has_value() ) {
2850  //Not a hallucination, go process the death effects.
2851  if( type->mdeath_effect.eoc.value().is_valid() ) {
2852  dialogue d( get_talker_for( *this ), nullptr );
2853  type->mdeath_effect.eoc.value()->activate( d );
2854  } else {
2855  debugmsg( "eoc id %s is not valid", type->mdeath_effect.eoc.value().str() );
2856  }
2857  }
2858 
2859  // scale overkill damage by enchantments
2860  if( nkiller && ( nkiller->is_npc() || nkiller->is_avatar() ) ) {
2861  int current_hp = get_hp();
2862  current_hp = nkiller->as_character()->enchantment_cache->modify_value(
2863  enchant_vals::mod::OVERKILL_DAMAGE, current_hp );
2864  set_hp( current_hp );
2865  }
2866 
2867  item_location corpse;
2868  // drop a corpse, or not - this needs to happen after the spell, for e.g. revivification effects
2869  switch( type->mdeath_effect.corpse_type ) {
2870  case mdeath_type::NORMAL:
2871  corpse = mdeath::normal( *this );
2872  break;
2873  case mdeath_type::BROKEN:
2874  mdeath::broken( *this );
2875  break;
2876  case mdeath_type::SPLATTER:
2877  corpse = mdeath::splatter( *this );
2878  break;
2879  default:
2880  break;
2881  }
2882 
2883  if( death_drops ) {
2884  // Drop items stored in optionals
2885  move_special_item_to_inv( tack_item );
2886  move_special_item_to_inv( armor_item );
2887  move_special_item_to_inv( storage_item );
2888  move_special_item_to_inv( tied_item );
2889 
2890  if( has_effect( effect_heavysnare ) ) {
2891  add_item( item( "rope_6", calendar::turn_zero ) );
2892  add_item( item( "snare_trigger", calendar::turn_zero ) );
2893  }
2894  }
2895 
2896  if( death_drops && !no_extra_death_drops ) {
2897  drop_items_on_death( corpse.get_item() );
2898  spawn_dissectables_on_death( corpse.get_item() );
2899  }
2900  if( death_drops && !is_hallucination() ) {
2901  for( const item &it : inv ) {
2902  if( it.has_var( "DESTROY_ITEM_ON_MON_DEATH" ) ) {
2903  continue;
2904  }
2905  if( corpse ) {
2906  corpse->force_insert_item( it, pocket_type::CONTAINER );
2907  } else {
2908  get_map().add_item_or_charges( pos(), it );
2909  }
2910  }
2911  for( const item &it : dissectable_inv ) {
2912  if( corpse ) {
2913  corpse->put_in( it, pocket_type::CORPSE );
2914  } else {
2915  get_map().add_item( pos(), it );
2916  }
2917  }
2918  }
2919  if( corpse ) {
2920  corpse->process( get_map(), nullptr, corpse.position() );
2921  corpse.make_active();
2922  }
2923 
2924  // Adjust anger/morale of nearby monsters, if they have the appropriate trigger and are friendly
2925  // Keep filtering on the dying monsters' triggers to preserve current functionality
2926  bool trigger = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ||
2927  type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ||
2928  type->has_placate_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED );
2929 
2930  if( trigger ) {
2931  int light = g->light_level( posz() );
2932  map &here = get_map();
2933  for( monster &critter : g->all_monsters() ) {
2934  // Do we actually care about this faction?
2935  if( critter.faction->attitude( faction ) != MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
2936  continue;
2937  }
2938 
2939  if( here.sees( critter.pos(), pos(), light ) ) {
2940  // Anger trumps fear trumps ennui
2941  if( critter.type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2942  critter.anger += 15;
2943  if( nkiller != nullptr && !nkiller->is_monster() && !nkiller->is_fake() ) {
2944  // A character killed our friend
2945  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s's character aggro triggered by killing a friendly %s",
2946  critter.name(), name() );
2947  critter.aggro_character = true;
2948  }
2949  } else if( critter.type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2950  critter.morale -= 15;
2951  } else if( critter.type->has_placate_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2952  critter.anger -= 15;
2953  }
2954  }
2955  }
2956  }
2957 }

3065  worn_it->best_pocket( it, loc, nullptr, false, true );
3066  if( internal_pocket.second != nullptr &&
3067  ( current_best.second == nullptr ||
3068  current_best.second->better_pocket( *internal_pocket.second, it ) ) ) {
3069  current_best = internal_pocket;
3070  }
3071  }
3072  if( current_best.second != nullptr ) {
3073  current_best.second->insert_item( it );
3074  } else {
3075  corpse->force_insert_item( it, pocket_type::CONTAINER );
3076  }
3077  }
3078  }

969  } else {

971  difficulty_str = _( "<color_light_gray>Minimal threat.</color>" );

975  difficulty_str = _( "<color_light_red>Dangerous.</color>" );

978  } else if( type->difficulty < 50 ) {

980  } else {

989  }, enumeration_conjunction::arrow );

1032  }

1035  enumerate_as_string( types ) ) + "\n";
1036  }
1037 
1038  using flag_description = std::pair<const mon_flag_id, std::string>;
1039  const auto describe_flags = [this, &ss](
1040  const std::string_view format,
1041  const std::vector<flag_description> &flags_names,
1042  const std::string &if_empty = "" ) {
1043  std::string flag_descriptions = enumerate_as_string( flags_names.begin(),
1044  flags_names.end(), [this]( const flag_description & fd ) {
1045  return type->has_flag( fd.first ) ? fd.second : "";
1046  } );
1047  if( !flag_descriptions.empty() ) {
1048  ss += string_format( format, flag_descriptions ) + "\n";
1049  } else if( !if_empty.empty() ) {
1050  ss += if_empty + "\n";
1051  }
1052  };
1053 
1054  using property_description = std::pair<bool, std::string>;
1055  const auto describe_properties = [&ss](
1056  const std::string_view format,
1057  const std::vector<property_description> &property_names,
1058  const std::string &if_empty = "" ) {
1059  std::string property_descriptions = enumerate_as_string( property_names.begin(),
1060  property_names.end(), []( const property_description & pd ) {
1061  return pd.first ? pd.second : "";
1062  } );
1063  if( !property_descriptions.empty() ) {
1064  ss += string_format( format, property_descriptions ) + "\n";
1065  } else if( !if_empty.empty() ) {
1066  ss += if_empty + "\n";
1067  }
1068  };
1069 
1070  describe_flags( _( "It has the following senses: %s." ), {
1071  {mon_flag_HEARS, pgettext( "Hearing as sense", "hearing" )},
1072  {mon_flag_SEES, pgettext( "Sight as sense", "sight" )},
1073  {mon_flag_SMELLS, pgettext( "Smell as sense", "smell" )},
1074  }, _( "It doesn't have senses." ) );
1075 
1076  describe_properties( _( "It can %s." ), {
1077  {swims(), pgettext( "Swim as an action", "swim" )},
1078  {flies(), pgettext( "Fly as an action", "fly" )},
1079  {can_dig(), pgettext( "Dig as an action", "dig" )},
1080  {climbs(), pgettext( "Climb as an action", "climb" )}
1081  } );
1082 
1083  describe_flags( _( "<bad>In fight it can %s.</bad>" ), {
1084  {mon_flag_GRABS, pgettext( "Grab as an action", "grab" )},
1085  {mon_flag_VENOM, pgettext( "Poison as an action", "poison" )},
1086  {mon_flag_PARALYZEVENOM, pgettext( "Paralyze as an action", "paralyze" )}
1087  } );
1088 
1089  if( !type->has_flag( mon_flag_NOHEAD ) ) {
1090  ss += std::string( _( "It has a head." ) ) + "\n";
1091  }
1092 
1093  if( debug_mode ) {
1094  ss += "--\n";
1095 
1096  ss += string_format( _( "Current Speed: %1$d" ), get_speed() ) + "\n";
1097  ss += string_format( _( "Anger: %1$d" ), anger ) + "\n";
1098  ss += string_format( _( "Friendly: %1$d" ), friendly ) + "\n";
1099  ss += string_format( _( "Morale: %1$d" ), morale ) + "\n";
1100  if( aggro_character ) {
1101  ss += string_format( _( "<color_red>Aggressive towards characters</color>" ) ) + "\n";
1102  }
1103 
1104  const time_duration current_time = calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero;
1105  ss += string_format( _( "Current Time: Turn %1$d | Day: %2$d" ),
1106  to_turns<int>( current_time ),
1107  to_days<int>( current_time ) ) + "\n";
1108 
1109  ss += string_format( _( "Upgrade time: %1$d (turns left %2$d) %3$s" ),
1110  upgrade_time,
1111  to_turns<int>( time_duration::from_days( upgrade_time ) - current_time ),
1112  can_upgrade() ? "" : _( "<color_red>(can't upgrade)</color>" ) ) + "\n";
1113 
1114  if( !special_attacks.empty() ) {
1115  ss += string_format( _( "%d special attack(s): " ), special_attacks.size() );
1116  for( const auto &attack : special_attacks ) {
1117  ss += string_format( _( "%s, cooldown %d; " ), attack.first.c_str(), attack.second.cooldown );
1118  }
1119  ss += "\n";
1120  }
1121 
1122  if( baby_timer.has_value() ) {
1123  ss += string_format( _( "Reproduce time: %1$d (turns left %2$d) %3$s" ),
1124  to_turn<int>( baby_timer.value() ),
1125  to_turn<int>( baby_timer.value() - current_time ),
1126  reproduces ? "" : _( "<color_red>(can't reproduce)</color>" ) ) + "\n";
1127  }
1128 
1129  if( biosig_timer.has_value() ) {
1130  ss += string_format( _( "Biosignature time: %1$d (turns left %2$d) %3$s" ),
1131  to_turn<int>( biosig_timer.value() ),
1132  to_turn<int>( biosig_timer.value() - current_time ),
1133  biosignatures ? "" : _( "<color_red>(no biosignature)</color>" ) ) + "\n";
1134  }
1135 
1136  if( lifespan_end.has_value() ) {
1137  ss += string_format( _( "Lifespan end time: %1$d (turns left %2$d)" ),
1138  to_turn<int>( lifespan_end.value() ),
1139  to_turn<int>( lifespan_end.value() - current_time ) );
1140  } else {
1141  ss += "Lifespan end time: n/a <color_yellow>(indefinite)</color>";
1142  }
1143  }
1144 
1145  return replace_colors( ss );
1146 }

1336  // Make sure they're actually dragging someone.
1337  if( !dragged_foe_id.is_valid() || !has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
1338  dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1339  return nullptr;
1340  }
1341 
1342  // Dragged critters may die or otherwise become invalid, which is why we look
1343  // them up each time. Luckily, monsters dragging critters is relatively rare,
1344  // so this check should happen infrequently.
1345  Character *dragged_foe = g->critter_by_id<Character>( dragged_foe_id );
1346

1348  // Target no longer valid.

1351  }

1429 {
1430  if( is_hallucination() ) {
1431  return;
1432  }
1433 
1434  if( made_footstep ) {
1435  return;
1436  }
1437  made_footstep = true;
1438  int volume = 6; // same as player's footsteps
1439  if( flies() || has_flag( mon_flag_SILENTMOVES ) ) {
1440  volume = 0; // Flying monsters don't have footsteps!
1441  }
1442  if( digging() ) {
1443  volume = 10;
1444  }
1445  switch( type->size ) {
1446  case creature_size::tiny:
1447  volume = 0; // No sound for the tinies
1448  break;
1449  case creature_size::small:
1450  volume /= 3;
1451  break;
1452  case creature_size::medium:
1453  break;
1454  case creature_size::large:
1455  volume *= 1.5;
1456  break;
1457  case creature_size::huge:
1458  volume *= 2;
1459  break;
1460  default:
1461  break;
1462  }
1463  if( has_flag( mon_flag_LOUDMOVES ) ) {
1464  volume += 6;
1465  } else if( has_flag( mon_flag_QUIETMOVES ) ) {
1466  volume -= 3;
1467  }
1468  if( volume == 0 ) {
1469  return;
1470  }

◆ group_bash_skill()

int monster::group_bash_skill ( const tripoint &  target)

Returns ability of monster and any cooperative helpers to bash the designated target.


Definition at line 1735 of file monmove.cpp.

1736 {
1737  if( !has_flag( mon_flag_GROUP_BASH ) ) {
1738  return bash_skill();
1739  }
1740  int bashskill = 0;
1741 
1742  // pileup = more bash skill, but only help bashing mob directly in front of target
1743  const int max_helper_depth = 5;
1744  const std::vector<tripoint> bzone = get_bashing_zone( target, pos(), max_helper_depth );
1745 
1746  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
1747  for( const tripoint &candidate : bzone ) {
1748  // Drawing this line backwards excludes the target and includes the candidate.
1749  std::vector<tripoint> path_to_target = line_to( target, candidate, 0, 0 );
1750  bool connected = true;
1751  monster *mon = nullptr;
1752  for( const tripoint &in_path : path_to_target ) {
1753  // If any point in the line from zombie to target is not a cooperating zombie,
1754  // it can't contribute.
1755  mon = creatures.creature_at<monster>( in_path );
1756  if( !mon ) {
1757  connected = false;
1758  break;
1759  }
1760  monster &helpermon = *mon;
1761  if( !helpermon.has_flag( mon_flag_GROUP_BASH ) || helpermon.is_hallucination() ) {
1762  connected = false;
1763  break;
1764  }
1765  }
1766  if( !connected || !mon ) {
1767  continue;
1768  }
1769  // If we made it here, the last monster checked was the candidate.
1770  monster &helpermon = *mon;
1771  // Contribution falls off rapidly with distance from target.
1772  bashskill += helpermon.bash_skill() / rl_dist( candidate, target );
1773  }
1774 
1775  return bashskill;
1776 }
line_to
std::vector< coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale, LhsInBounds &&RhsInBounds > > line_to(const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale, LhsInBounds > &loc1, const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale, RhsInBounds > &loc2)
Definition: coordinates.h:798
get_bashing_zone
static std::vector< tripoint > get_bashing_zone(const tripoint &bashee, const tripoint &basher, int maxdepth)
Definition: monmove.cpp:1650

Flat addition to the monsters hp.

If overheal is true, this is not capped by max hp. Returns actually healed hp.

3761  if( !can_hear() ) {
3762  return;
3763  }
3764 
3765  const bool goodhearing = has_flag( mon_flag_GOODHEARING );
3766  const int volume = goodhearing ? 2 * vol - dist : vol - dist;
3767  // Error is based on volume, louder sound = less error
3768  if( volume <= 0 ) {
3769  return;
3770  }
3771 
3772  int tmp_provocative = provocative || volume >= normal_roll( 30, 5 );
3773  // already following a more interesting sound
3774  if( provocative_sound && !tmp_provocative && wandf > 0 ) {
3775  return;
3776  }
3777 
3778  int max_error = 0;
3779  if( volume < 2 ) {
3780  max_error = 10;
3781  } else if( volume < 5 ) {
3782  max_error = 5;
3783  } else if( volume < 10 ) {
3784  max_error = 3;
3785  } else if( volume < 20 ) {
3786  max_error = 1;
3787  }
3788 
3789  tripoint_abs_ms target = get_map().getglobal( source ) + point( rng( -max_error, max_error ),
3790  rng( -max_error, max_error ) );
3791  // target_z will require some special check due to soil muffling sounds
3792 
3793  const int wander_turns = volume * ( goodhearing ? 6 : 1 );
3794  // again, already following a more interesting sound
3795  if( wander_turns < wandf ) {
3796  return;
3797  }
3798  // only trigger this if the monster is not friendly or the source isn't the player
3799  if( friendly == 0 || source != get_player_character().pos() ) {
3800  process_trigger( mon_trigger::SOUND, volume );
3801  }
3802  provocative_sound = tmp_provocative;
3803  if( morale >= 0 && anger >= 10 ) {
3804  // TODO: Add a proper check for fleeing attitude
3805  // but cache it nicely, because this part is called a lot
3806  wander_to( target, wander_turns );
3807  } else if( morale < 0 ) {
3808  // Monsters afraid of sound should not go towards sound.
3809  // Move towards a point on the opposite side of us from the target.
3810  // TODO: make the destination scale with the sound and handle
3811  // the case when (x,y) is the same by picking a random direction
3812  tripoint_abs_ms away = get_location() + ( get_location() - target );
3813  away.z() = posz();
3814  wander_to( away, wander_turns );
3815  }
3816 }

◆ init_from_item()

void monster::init_from_item ( item &  itm)

Initialize values like speed / hp from data of an item.

This applies to robotic monsters that are spawned by invoking an item (e.g. turret), and to reviving monsters that spawn from a corpse.

◆ is_aquatic_danger()

bool monster::is_aquatic_danger ( const tripoint &  at_pos) const

Returns true if the given square presents a possibility of drowning for the monster: it's deep water, it's liquid, the monster can drown, and there is no boardable vehicle part present.

◆ is_immune_field()

bool monster::is_immune_field ( const field_type_id &  ) const
overridevirtual

Returns true if we are immune to the field type with the given fid.

Can handle intensity if field intensity data is specified for the effect , so this function should only be called through is_dangerous_field().

Reimplemented from Creature.

Definition at line 93 of file monmove.cpp.

94 {
95  if( fid == fd_fungal_haze ) {
96  return has_flag( mon_flag_NO_BREATHE ) || type->in_species( species_FUNGUS );
97  }
98  if( fid == fd_fungicidal_gas ) {
99  return !type->in_species( species_FUNGUS );
100  }
101  if( fid == fd_insecticidal_gas ) {
102  return !made_of( material_iflesh ) || has_flag( mon_flag_INSECTICIDEPROOF );
103  }
104  if( fid == fd_web ) {
105  return has_flag( mon_flag_WEBWALK );
106  }
107  if( fid == fd_sludge || fid == fd_sap ) {
108  return flies();
109  }
110  const field_type &ft = fid.obj();
111  if( ft.has_fume ) {
112  return has_flag( mon_flag_NO_BREATHE );
113  }
114  if( ft.has_acid ) {
115  return has_flag( mon_flag_ACIDPROOF ) || flies();
116  }
117  if( ft.has_fire ) {
118  return has_flag( mon_flag_FIREPROOF );
119  }
120  if( ft.has_elec ) {
121  return has_flag( mon_flag_ELECTRIC );
122  }
123  if( ft.immune_mtypes.count( type->id ) > 0 ) {
124  return true;
125  }
126  // No specific immunity was found, so fall upwards
127  return Creature::is_immune_field( fid );
128 }

◆ know_danger_at()

bool monster::know_danger_at ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 237 of file monmove.cpp.

238 {
239  map &here = get_map();
240 
241  // Various avoiding behaviors.
242 
243  bool avoid_fire = has_flag( mon_flag_PATH_AVOID_FIRE );
244  bool avoid_fall = has_flag( mon_flag_PATH_AVOID_FALL );
245  bool avoid_simple = has_flag( mon_flag_PATH_AVOID_DANGER_1 );
246  bool avoid_complex = has_flag( mon_flag_PATH_AVOID_DANGER_2 );
247  bool avoid_sharp = get_pathfinding_settings().avoid_sharp;
248  bool avoid_traps = get_pathfinding_settings().avoid_traps;
249  /*
250  * Because some avoidance behaviors are supersets of others,
251  * we can cascade through the implications. Complex implies simple,
252  * and simple implies fire and fall.
253  * unfortunately, fall does not necessarily imply fire, nor the converse.
254  */
255  if( avoid_complex ) {
256  avoid_simple = true;
257  avoid_traps = true;
258  }
259  if( avoid_simple ) {
260  avoid_fire = true;
261  avoid_fall = true;
262  avoid_sharp = true;
263  }
264 
265  // technically this will shortcut in evaluation from fire or fall
266  // before hitting simple or complex but this is more explicit
267  if( avoid_fire || avoid_fall || avoid_simple ||
268  avoid_complex || avoid_traps || avoid_sharp ) {
269  const ter_id target = here.ter( p );
270  if( !here.has_vehicle_floor( p ) ) {
271  // Don't enter lava if we have any concept of heat being bad
272  if( avoid_fire && target == ter_t_lava ) {
273  return false;
274  }
275 
276  if( avoid_fall ) {
277  // Don't throw ourselves off cliffs if we have a concept of falling
278  if( !here.has_floor_or_water( p ) && !flies() ) {
279  return false;
280  }
281 
282  // Don't enter open pits ever unless tiny, can fly or climb well
283  if( !( type->size == creature_size::tiny || can_climb() ) &&
284  ( target == ter_t_pit || target == ter_t_pit_spiked || target == ter_t_pit_glass ) ) {
285  return false;
286  }
287  }
288 
289  // Some things are only avoided if we're not attacking
290  if( get_player_character().get_location() != get_dest() ||
291  attitude( &get_player_character() ) != MATT_ATTACK ) {
292  // Sharp terrain is ignored while attacking
293  if( avoid_sharp && here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SHARP, p ) &&
294  !( type->size == creature_size::tiny || flies() ||
295  get_armor_type( damage_cut, bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) >= 10 ) ) {
296  return false;
297  }
298  }
299 
300  // Don't step on any traps (if we can see)
301  const trap &target_trap = here.tr_at( p );
302  if( avoid_traps && has_flag( mon_flag_SEES ) &&
303  !target_trap.is_benign() && here.has_floor_or_water( p ) ) {
304  return false;
305  }
306  }
307 
308  const field &target_field = here.field_at( p );
309  // Higher awareness is needed for identifying these as threats.
310  if( avoid_complex ) {
311  // Don't enter any dangerous fields
312  if( is_dangerous_fields( target_field ) ) {
313  return false;
314  }
315  }
316 
317  // Without avoid_complex, only fire and electricity are checked for field avoidance.
318  if( avoid_fire && target_field.find_field( fd_fire ) && !is_immune_field( fd_fire ) ) {
319  return false;
320  }
321  if( avoid_simple && target_field.find_field( fd_electricity ) &&
322  !is_immune_field( fd_electricity ) ) {
323  return false;
324  }
325  }
326 
327  return true;
328 }
Creature::is_dangerous_fields
bool is_dangerous_fields(const field &fld) const
Returns true if there is a field in the field set that is dangerous to us.

2434  data.read( "destination", destination );
2435  if( destination != tripoint_zero ) {
2436  goal = get_location() + destination;

2441  if( montype.is_valid() ) {
2442  type = &montype.obj();
2443  } else { // type is invalid (monster deleted from data - replace with something neutral)

2446  }

2455  data.read( "next_patrol_point", next_patrol_point );
2456  data.read( "patrol_route", patrol_route );
2457  }
2458  if( data.has_object( "tied_item" ) ) {

2460  item newitem;
2461  newitem.deserialize( tied_item_json );
2462  tied_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
2463  }
2464  if( data.has_object( "tack_item" ) ) {
2465  JsonValue tack_item_json = data.get_member( "tack_item" );
2466  item newitem;
2467  newitem.deserialize( tack_item_json );
2468  tack_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
2469  }
2470  if( data.has_object( "armor_item" ) ) {
2471  JsonValue armor_item_json = data.get_member( "armor_item" );
2472  item newitem;
2473  newitem.deserialize( armor_item_json );
2474  armor_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
2475  }
2476  if( data.has_object( "storage_item" ) ) {
2477  JsonValue storage_item_json = data.get_member( "storage_item" );
2478  item newitem;
2479  newitem.deserialize( storage_item_json );
2480  storage_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
2481  }
2482  if( data.has_object( "battery_item" ) ) {
2483  JsonValue battery_item_json = data.get_member( "battery_item" );
2484  item newitem;
2485  newitem.deserialize( battery_item_json );
2486  battery_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
2487  }
2488  data.read( "hp", hp );
2489 
2490  // sp_timeout indicates an old save, prior to the special_attacks refactor
2491  if( data.has_array( "sp_timeout" ) ) {
2492  JsonArray parray = data.get_array( "sp_timeout" );
2493  size_t index = 0;
2494  int ptimeout = 0;
2495  while( parray.has_more() && index < type->special_attacks_names.size() ) {
2496  if( parray.read_next( ptimeout ) ) {
2497  // assume timeouts saved in same order as current monsters.json listing
2498  const std::string &aname = type->special_attacks_names[index++];
2499  auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
2500  if( ptimeout >= 0 ) {
2501  entry.cooldown = ptimeout;
2502  } else { // -1 means disabled, unclear what <-1 values mean in old saves
2503  entry.cooldown = type->special_attacks.at( aname )->cooldown;
2504  entry.enabled = false;
2505  }
2506  }
2507  }
2508  }
2509 
2510  // special_attacks indicates a save after the special_attacks refactor
2511  if( data.has_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
2512  for( const JsonMember member : data.get_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
2513  JsonObject saobject = member.get_object();
2514  saobject.allow_omitted_members();
2515  auto &entry = special_attacks[member.name()];
2516  entry.cooldown = saobject.get_int( "cooldown" );
2517  entry.enabled = saobject.get_bool( "enabled" );
2518  }
2519  }
2520 
2521  // make sure the loaded monster has every special attack its type says it should have
2522  for( const auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {
2523  const std::string &aname = sa.first;
2524  if( special_attacks.find( aname ) == special_attacks.end() ) {
2525  auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
2526  entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );
2527  }
2528  }
2529 
2530  data.read( "friendly", friendly );
2531  if( data.has_member( "mission_ids" ) ) {
2532  data.read( "mission_ids", mission_ids );
2533  } else if( data.has_member( "mission_id" ) ) {
2534  const int mission_id = data.get_int( "mission_id" );
2535  if( mission_id > 0 ) {
2536  mission_ids = { mission_id };
2537  } else {
2538  mission_ids.clear();
2539  }
2540  }
2541  data.read( "mission_fused", mission_fused );
2542  data.read( "no_extra_death_drops", no_extra_death_drops );
2543  data.read( "dead", dead );
2544  data.read( "anger", anger );
2545  data.read( "morale", morale );
2546  data.read( "hallucination", hallucination );
2547  data.read( "aggro_character", aggro_character );
2548  data.read( "fish_population", fish_population );
2549  //for older saves convert summon time limit to lifespan end
2550  std::optional<time_duration> summon_time_limit;
2551  data.read( "summon_time_limit", summon_time_limit );
2552  if( summon_time_limit ) {
2553  set_summon_time( *summon_time_limit );
2554  }
2555 
2556  upgrades = data.get_bool( "upgrades", type->upgrades );
2557  upgrade_time = data.get_int( "upgrade_time", -1 );
2558 
2559  reproduces = data.get_bool( "reproduces", type->reproduces );
2560  baby_timer.reset();
2561  data.read( "baby_timer", baby_timer );
2562  if( baby_timer && *baby_timer == calendar::before_time_starts ) {
2563  baby_timer.reset();
2564  }
2565 
2566  biosignatures = data.get_bool( "biosignatures", type->biosignatures );
2567  biosig_timer = time_point( data.get_int( "biosig_timer", -1 ) );
2568 
2569  data.read( "udder_timer", udder_timer );
2570 
2571  horde_attraction = static_cast<monster_horde_attraction>( data.get_int( "horde_attraction", 0 ) );
2572 
2573  data.read( "inv", inv );
2574  data.read( "dissectable_inv", dissectable_inv );
2575  data.read( "dragged_foe_id", dragged_foe_id );
2576 
2577  data.read( "ammo", ammo );
2578 
2579  const mfaction_str_id mfac( data.get_string( "faction", "invalid*faction" ) );
2580  if( mfac.is_valid() ) {
2581  faction = mfac;
2582  } else {
2583  faction = monfaction_factionless;
2584  DebugLog( D_WARNING, DC_ALL ) << "mfaction " << mfac.str() << "' is invalid, set to factionless";
2585  }
2586 
2587  data.read( "mounted_player_id", mounted_player_id );
2588  data.read( "path", path );
2589 
2590  data.read( "grabbed_limbs", grabbed_limbs );
2591 }

2402 {
2403  load( data );
2404  if( !data.has_member( "location" ) ) {
2405  // When loading an older save in which the monster's absolute location is not serialized
2406  // and the monster is not in the current map, the submap location inferred by load()
2407  // will be wrong. Use the supplied argument to fix it.
2408  const tripoint_abs_ms old_loc = get_location();
2409  point_abs_sm wrong_submap;
2410  tripoint_sm_ms_ib local_pos;
2411  std::tie( wrong_submap, local_pos ) = project_remain<coords::sm>( get_location() );
2412  set_location( project_combine( submap_loc.xy(), local_pos ) );
2413  // adjust other relative coordinates that would be subject to the same error
2414  wander_pos = wander_pos - old_loc + get_location();
2415  if( goal ) {
2416  *goal = *goal - old_loc + get_location();
2417  }
2418  }
2419 }

◆ melee_attack() [3/3]

bool monster::melee_attack ( Creature &  target,
float  accuracy 
)

Definition at line 1903 of file monster.cpp.

1904 {
1905  // Note: currently this method must consume move even if attack hasn't actually happen
1906  // otherwise infinite loop will happen
1907  mod_moves( -type->attack_cost );
1908  if( /*This happens sometimes*/ this == &target || !is_adjacent( &target, true ) ) {
1909  return false;
1910  }
1911  if( !sees( target ) && !target.is_hallucination() ) {
1912  debugmsg( "Z-Level view violation: %s tried to attack %s.", disp_name(), target.disp_name() );
1913  return false;
1914  }
1915 
1916  const int monster_hit_roll = melee::melee_hit_range( accuracy );
1917  int hitspread = target.deal_melee_attack( this, monster_hit_roll );
1918  if( type->melee_dice == 0 ) {
1919  // We don't hit, so just return
1920  return true;
1921  }
1922 
1923  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1924  if( target.is_avatar() ||
1925  ( target.is_npc() && player_character.attitude_to( target ) == Attitude::FRIENDLY ) ) {
1926  // Make us a valid target for a few turns
1927  add_effect( effect_hit_by_player, 3_turns );
1928  }
1929 
1930  if( has_flag( mon_flag_HIT_AND_RUN ) ) {
1931  add_effect( effect_run, 4_turns );
1932  }
1933 
1934  const bool u_see_me = player_character.sees( *this );
1935  const bool u_see_my_spot = player_character.sees( this->pos() );
1936  const bool u_see_target = player_character.sees( target );
1937 
1938  damage_instance damage = !is_hallucination() ? type->melee_damage : damage_instance();
1939  if( !is_hallucination() && type->melee_dice > 0 ) {
1940  damage.add_damage( damage_bash, dice( type->melee_dice, type->melee_sides ) );
1941  }
1942 
1943  dealt_damage_instance dealt_dam;
1944 
1945  if( hitspread >= 0 ) {
1946  target.deal_melee_hit( this, hitspread, false, damage, dealt_dam );
1947  }
1948 
1949  const int total_dealt = dealt_dam.total_damage();
1950  if( hitspread < 0 ) {
1951  bool monster_missed = monster_hit_roll < 0.0;
1952  // Miss
1953  if( u_see_my_spot && !target.in_sleep_state() ) {
1954  if( target.is_avatar() ) {
1955  if( monster_missed ) {
1956  add_msg( _( "%s misses you." ), u_see_me ? disp_name( false, true ) : _( "Something" ) );
1957  } else {
1958  add_msg( _( "You dodge %s." ), u_see_me ? disp_name() : _( "something" ) );
1959  }
1960  } else if( target.is_npc() ) {
1961  if( monster_missed ) {
1962  add_msg( _( "%1$s misses %2$s!" ),
1963  u_see_me ? disp_name( false, true ) : _( "Something" ), target.disp_name() );
1964  } else {
1965  add_msg( _( "%1$s dodges %2$s attack." ),
1966  target.disp_name(), u_see_me ? name() : _( "something" ) );
1967  }
1968  }
1969  } else if( target.is_avatar() ) {
1970  add_msg( _( "You dodge an attack from an unseen source." ) );
1971  }
1972  } else if( is_hallucination() || total_dealt > 0 ) {
1973  // Hallucinations always produce messages but never actually deal damage
1974  if( u_see_my_spot ) {
1975  if( target.is_avatar() ) {
1976  sfx::play_variant_sound( "melee_attack", "monster_melee_hit",
1977  sfx::get_heard_volume( target.pos() ) );
1978  // don't make a pain yelp if our limb is a bionic
1979  if( !dealt_dam.bp_hit->has_flag( json_flag_BIONIC_LIMB ) ) {
1980  sfx::do_player_death_hurt( dynamic_cast<Character &>( target ), false );
1981  }
1982  //~ 1$s is attacker name, 2$s is bodypart name in accusative.
1983  add_msg( m_bad, _( "%1$s hits your %2$s." ), u_see_me ? disp_name( false, true ) : _( "Something" ),
1984  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ) );
1985  } else if( target.is_npc() ) {
1986  if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && has_flag( mon_flag_RIDEABLE_MECH ) &&
1987  pos() == player_character.pos() ) {
1988  //~ %1$s: name of your mount, %2$s: target NPC name, %3$d: damage value
1989  add_msg( m_good, _( "Your %1$s hits %2$s for %3$d damage!" ), name(), target.disp_name(),
1990  total_dealt );
1991  } else {
1992  //~ %1$s: attacker name, %2$s: target NPC name, %3$s: bodypart name in accusative
1993  add_msg( _( "%1$s hits %2$s %3$s." ), u_see_me ? disp_name( false, true ) : _( "Something" ),
1994  target.disp_name( true ),
1995  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ) );
1996  }
1997  } else {
1998  if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && has_flag( mon_flag_RIDEABLE_MECH ) &&
1999  pos() == player_character.pos() ) {
2000  //~ %1$s: name of your mount, %2$s: target creature name, %3$d: damage value
2001  add_msg( m_good, _( "Your %1$s hits %2$s for %3$d damage!" ), get_name(), target.disp_name(),
2002  total_dealt );
2003  }
2004  if( get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_ATTACK_MONSTER" ) ) {
2005  if( !u_see_me && u_see_target ) {
2006  add_msg( _( "Something hits the %1$s!" ), target.disp_name() );
2007  } else if( !u_see_target ) {
2008  add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits something!" ), name() );
2009  } else {
2010  //~ %1$s: attacker name, %2$s: target creature name
2011  add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits %2$s!" ), name(), target.disp_name() );
2012  }
2013  }
2014  }
2015  } else if( target.is_avatar() ) {
2016  //~ %s is bodypart name in accusative.
2017  add_msg( m_bad, _( "Something hits your %s." ),
2018  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ) );
2019  }
2020  } else {
2021  // No damage dealt
2022  if( u_see_my_spot ) {
2023  if( target.is_avatar() ) {
2024  //~ 1$s is attacker name, 2$s is bodypart name in accusative, 3$s is armor name
2025  add_msg( _( "%1$s hits your %2$s, but your %3$s protects you." ), u_see_me ? disp_name( false,
2026  true ) : _( "Something" ),
2027  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ), target.skin_name() );
2028  } else if( target.is_npc() ) {
2029  //~ $1s is monster name, %2$s is that monster target name,
2030  //~ $3s is target bodypart name in accusative, $4s is the monster target name,
2031  //~ 5$s is target armor name.
2032  add_msg( _( "%1$s hits %2$s %3$s but is stopped by %4$s %5$s." ), u_see_me ? disp_name( false,
2033  true ) : _( "Something" ),
2034  target.disp_name( true ),
2035  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ),
2036  target.disp_name( true ),
2037  target.skin_name() );
2038  } else if( get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_ATTACK_MONSTER" ) ) {
2039  //~ $1s is monster name, %2$s is that monster target name,
2040  //~ $3s is target armor name.
2041  add_msg( _( "%1$s hits %2$s but is stopped by its %3$s." ),
2042  u_see_me ? disp_name( false, true ) : _( "Something" ),
2043  target.disp_name(),
2044  target.skin_name() );
2045  }
2046  } else if( target.is_avatar() ) {
2047  //~ 1$s is bodypart name in accusative, 2$s is armor name.
2048  add_msg( _( "Something hits your %1$s, but your %2$s protects you." ),
2049  body_part_name_accusative( dealt_dam.bp_hit ), target.skin_name() );
2050  }
2051  }
2052 
2053  target.check_dead_state();
2054 
2055  if( is_hallucination() ) {
2056  if( one_in( 7 ) ) {
2057  die( nullptr );
2058  }
2059  return true;
2060  }
2061 
2062  if( total_dealt <= 0 ) {
2063  return true;
2064  }
2065 
2066  // Add any on damage effects
2067  for( const mon_effect_data &eff : type->atk_effs ) {
2068  if( x_in_y( eff.chance, 100 ) ) {
2069  const bodypart_id affected_bp = eff.affect_hit_bp ? dealt_dam.bp_hit : eff.bp.id();
2070  target.add_effect( eff.id, time_duration::from_turns( rng( eff.duration.first,
2071  eff.duration.second ) ), affected_bp, eff.permanent, rng( eff.intensity.first,
2072  eff.intensity.second ) );
2073  target.add_msg_if_player( m_mixed, eff.message, name() );
2074  }
2075  }
2076 
2077  const int stab_cut = dealt_dam.type_damage( damage_cut ) + dealt_dam.type_damage( damage_stab );
2078 
2079  if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( mon_flag_VENOM ) ) {
2080  target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You're envenomed!" ) );
2081  target.add_effect( effect_poison, 3_minutes );
2082  }
2083 
2084  if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( mon_flag_BADVENOM ) ) {
2085  target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
2086  _( "You feel venom flood your body, wracking you with pain…" ) );
2087  target.add_effect( effect_badpoison, 4_minutes );
2088  }
2089 
2090  if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( mon_flag_PARALYZEVENOM ) ) {
2091  target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You feel venom enter your body!" ) );
2092  target.add_effect( effect_paralyzepoison, 10_minutes );
2093  }
2094  return true;
2095 }

◆ monster_move_in_vehicle()

bool monster::monster_move_in_vehicle ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 135 of file monmove.cpp.

136 {
137  map &m = get_map();
138  monster critter = *this;
139  const optional_vpart_position vp = m.veh_at( p );
140  if( vp.has_value() ) {
141  vehicle &veh = vp->vehicle();
142  units::volume capacity = 0_ml;
143  units::volume free_cargo = 0_ml;
144  auto cargo_parts = veh.get_parts_at( p, "CARGO", part_status_flag::any );
145  for( vehicle_part *&part : cargo_parts ) {
146  vehicle_stack contents = veh.get_items( *part );
147  if( !vp.part_with_feature( "CARGO_PASSABLE", false ) &&
148  !vp.part_with_feature( "APPLIANCE", false ) && !vp.part_with_feature( "OBSTACLE", false ) ) {
149  capacity += contents.max_volume();
150  free_cargo += contents.free_volume();
151  }
152  }
153  if( capacity > 0_ml ) {
154  // First, we'll try to squeeze in. Open-topped vehicle parts have more room to step over cargo.
155  if( !veh.enclosed_at( p ) ) {
156  free_cargo *= 1.2;
157  }
158  if( !veh.enclosed_at( p ) && flies() ) {
159  return true; // No amount of cargo will block a flying monster if there's no roof.
160  }
161  const creature_size size = get_size();
162  if( ( size == creature_size::tiny && free_cargo < 15625_ml ) ||
163  ( size == creature_size::small && free_cargo < 31250_ml ) ||
164  ( size == creature_size::medium && free_cargo < 62500_ml ) ||
165  ( size == creature_size::large && free_cargo < 125000_ml ) ||
166  ( size == creature_size::huge && free_cargo < 250000_ml ) ) {
167  if( ( size == creature_size::tiny && free_cargo < 11719_ml ) ||
168  ( size == creature_size::small && free_cargo < 23438_ml ) ||
169  ( size == creature_size::medium && free_cargo < 46875_ml ) ||
170  ( size == creature_size::large && free_cargo < 93750_ml ) ||
171  ( size == creature_size::huge && free_cargo < 187500_ml ) ||
172  ( get_volume() > 850000_ml && !vp.part_with_feature( "HUGE_OK", false ) ) ) {
173  return false; // Return false if there's just no room whatsoever. Anything over 850 liters will simply never fit in a vehicle part that isn't specifically made for it.
174  // I'm sorry but you can't let a kaiju ride shotgun.
175  }
176  if( type->bodytype == "snake" || type->bodytype == "blob" || type->bodytype == "fish" ||
177  has_flag( mon_flag_PLASTIC ) || has_flag( mon_flag_SMALL_HIDER ) ) {
178  return true; // Return true if we're wiggly enough to be fine with cramped space.
179  }
180  critter.add_effect( effect_cramped_space, 2_turns, true );
181  return true; // Otherwise we add the effect and return true.
182  }
183  if( size == creature_size::huge && !vp.part_with_feature( "AISLE", false ) &&
184  !vp.part_with_feature( "HUGE_OK", false ) ) {
185  critter.add_effect( effect_cramped_space, 2_turns, true );
186  return true; // Sufficiently gigantic creatures have trouble in stock seats, roof or no.
187  }
188  }
189  }
190  return true;
191 }

void monster::move ( )

866 {
867  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONMOVE, "Monster %s starting monmove::move, remaining moves %d",
868  name(), moves );
869  // We decrement wandf no matter what. We'll save our wander_to plans until
870  // after we finish out set_dest plans, UNLESS they time out first.
871  if( wandf > 0 ) {
872  wandf--;
873  }
874 
875  //Hallucinations have a chance of disappearing each turn
876  if( is_hallucination() && one_in( 25 ) ) {
877  die( nullptr );
878  return;
879  }
880  map &here = get_map();
881  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
882 
883  behavior::monster_oracle_t oracle( this );
884  behavior::tree goals;
885  goals.add( type->get_goals() );
886  std::string action = goals.tick( &oracle );
887  //The monster can consume objects it stands on. Check if there are any.
888  //If there are. Consume them.
889  // TODO: Stick this in a map and dispatch to it via the action string.
890  // TODO: Create a special attacks whitelist unordered map instead of an if chain.
891  std::map<std::string, mtype_special_attack>::const_iterator attack =
892  type->special_attacks.find( action );
893  if( attack != type->special_attacks.end() && attack->second->call( *this ) ) {
894  if( special_attacks.count( action ) != 0 ) {
895  reset_special( action );
896  }
897  }
898  // record position before moving to put the player there if we're dragging
899  tripoint_abs_ms drag_to = get_location();
900 
901  const bool pacified = has_effect( effect_pacified );
902 
903  // First, use the special attack, if we can!
904  // The attack may change `monster::special_attacks` (e.g. by transforming
905  // this into another monster type). Therefore we can not iterate over it
906  // directly and instead iterate over the map from the monster type
907  // (properties of monster types should never change).
908  for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {
909  const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;
910  const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
911  if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
912  continue;
913  }
914  mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
915  if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
916  continue;
917  }
918 
919  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MATTACK, "%s attempting a special attack %s, cooldown %d", name(),
920  sp_type.first, local_attack_data.cooldown );
921 
922  // Cooldowns are decremented in monster::process_turn
923 
924  if( local_attack_data.cooldown == 0 && !pacified && !is_hallucination() ) {
925  if( !sp_type.second->call( *this ) ) {
926  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MATTACK, "Attack failed" );
927  continue;
928  }
929 
930  // `special_attacks` might have changed at this point. Sadly `reset_special`
931  // doesn't check the attack name, so we need to do it here.
932  if( special_attacks.count( special_name ) == 0 ) {
933  continue;
934  }
935  reset_special( special_name );
936  }
937  }
938 
939  // Check if they're dragging a foe and find their hapless victim
940  Character *dragged_foe = find_dragged_foe();
941 
942  // Give nursebots a chance to do surgery.
943  nursebot_operate( dragged_foe );
944 
945  // The monster can sometimes hang in air due to last fall being blocked
946  if( !flies() && !here.has_floor_or_water( pos() ) && !here.has_vehicle_floor( pos_bub() ) ) {
947  here.creature_on_trap( *this, false );
948  if( is_dead() ) {
949  return;
950  }
951  }
952 
953  // if the monster is in a deep water tile, it has a chance to drown
954  if( die_if_drowning( pos(), 10 ) ) {
955  return;
956  }
957 
958  if( moves < 0 ) {
959  return;
960  }
961 
962  // TODO: Move this to attack_at/move_to/etc. functions
963  bool attacking = false;
964  if( !move_effects( attacking ) ) {
965  moves = 0;
966  return;
967  }
968  if( has_flag( mon_flag_IMMOBILE ) || has_flag( mon_flag_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
969  moves = 0;
970  return;
971  }
972  if( has_effect( effect_stunned ) || has_effect( effect_psi_stunned ) ) {
973  stumble();
974  moves = 0;
975  return;
976  }
977  if( friendly > 0 ) {
978  --friendly;
979  }
980  const optional_vpart_position ovp = here.veh_at( pos() );
981  if( has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
982  if( !ovp.part_with_feature( "ANIMAL_CTRL", true ) ) {
983  remove_effect( effect_harnessed ); // the harness part probably broke
984  } else {
985  moves = 0;
986  return; // don't move if harnessed
987  }
988  }
989  const std::optional<vpart_reference> vp_boardable = ovp.part_with_feature( "BOARDABLE", true );
990  if( vp_boardable && friendly != 0 ) {
991  const vehicle &veh = vp_boardable->vehicle();
992  if( veh.is_moving() && veh.get_monster( vp_boardable->part_index() ) ) {
993  moves = 0;
994  return; // don't move if friendly and passenger in a moving vehicle
995  }
996  }
997  // Set attitude to attitude to our current target
998  monster_attitude current_attitude = attitude( nullptr );
999  if( !is_wandering() ) {
1000  if( get_dest() == player_character.get_location() ) {
1001  current_attitude = attitude( &player_character );
1002  } else {
1003  for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
1004  if( get_dest() == guy.get_location() ) {
1005  current_attitude = attitude( &guy );
1006  }
1007  }
1008  }
1009  }
1010 
1011  if( is_pet_follow() || ( friendly != 0 && has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) ) ) {
1012  const int dist = rl_dist( get_location(), get_dest() );
1013  if( ( dist <= 1 || ( dist <= 2 && !has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) &&
1014  sees( player_character ) ) ) &&
1015  ( get_dest() == player_character.get_location() &&
1016  get_location().z() == player_character.get_location().z() ) ) {
1017  moves = 0;
1018  stumble();
1019  return;
1020  }
1021  } else if( ( current_attitude == MATT_IGNORE && patrol_route.empty() ) ||
1022  ( ( current_attitude == MATT_FOLLOW ||
1023  ( has_flag( mon_flag_KEEP_DISTANCE ) && !( current_attitude == MATT_FLEE ) ) )
1024  && rl_dist( get_location(), get_dest() ) <= type->tracking_distance ) ) {
1025  moves = 0;
1026  stumble();
1027  return;
1028  }
1029 
1030  bool moved = false;
1031  tripoint destination;
1032 
1033  bool try_to_move = false;
1034  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
1035  for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1036  if( dest != pos() ) {
1037  if( can_move_to( dest ) &&
1038  creatures.creature_at( dest, true ) == nullptr ) {
1039  try_to_move = true;
1040  break;
1041  }
1042  }
1043  }
1044 
1045  // If true, don't try to greedily avoid locally bad paths
1046  bool pathed = false;
1047  tripoint local_dest = here.getlocal( get_dest() );
1048  if( try_to_move ) {
1049  // Move using vision by follow smells and sounds
1050  bool move_without_target = false;
1051  if( is_wandering() && has_intelligence() && can_see() ) {
1052  if( has_flag( mon_flag_SMELLS ) ) {
1053  unset_dest();
1054  tripoint tmp = scent_move();
1055  if( tmp.x != -1 ) {
1056  local_dest = tmp;
1057  move_without_target = true;
1058  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONMOVE, "%s follows smell using vision", name() );
1059  }
1060  }
1061  if( !move_without_target && wandf > 0 && friendly == 0 ) {
1062  unset_dest();
1063  if( wander_pos != get_location() ) {
1064  local_dest = here.getlocal( wander_pos );
1065  move_without_target = true;
1066  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONMOVE, "%s follows sound using vision", name() );
1067  }
1068  }
1069  }
1070 
1071  if( !is_wandering() || move_without_target ) {
1072  while( !path.empty() && path.front() == pos() ) {
1073  path.erase( path.begin() );
1074  }
1075 
1076  const pathfinding_settings &pf_settings = get_pathfinding_settings();
1077  if( pf_settings.max_dist >= rl_dist( get_location(), get_dest() ) &&
1078  ( path.empty() || rl_dist( pos(), path.front() ) >= 2 || path.back() != local_dest ) ) {
1079  // We need a new path
1080  if( can_pathfind() ) {
1081  path = here.route( pos(), local_dest, pf_settings, get_path_avoid() );
1082  if( path.empty() ) {
1083  increment_pathfinding_cd();
1084  }
1085  } else {
1086  path = here.straight_route( pos(), local_dest );
1087  if( !path.empty() ) {
1088  std::unordered_set<tripoint> closed = get_path_avoid();
1089  if( std::any_of( path.begin(), path.end(), [&closed]( const tripoint & p ) {
1090  return closed.count( p );
1091  } ) ) {
1092  path.clear();
1093  }
1094  }
1095  }
1096  if( !path.empty() ) {
1097  reset_pathfinding_cd();
1098  }
1099  }
1100 
1101  // Try to respect old paths, even if we can't pathfind at the moment
1102  if( !path.empty() && path.back() == local_dest ) {
1103  destination = path.front();
1104  moved = true;
1105  pathed = true;
1106  } else {
1107  // Straight line forward, probably because we can't pathfind (well enough)
1108  destination = local_dest;
1109  moved = true;
1110  }
1111  }
1112  }
1113  if( !moved && has_flag( mon_flag_SMELLS ) ) {
1114  // No sight... or our plans are invalid (e.g. moving through a transparent, but
1115  // solid, square of terrain). Fall back to smell if we have it.
1116  unset_dest();
1117  tripoint tmp = scent_move();
1118  if( tmp.x != -1 ) {
1119  destination = tmp;
1120  moved = true;
1121  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONMOVE, "%s follows smell to not use vision", name() );
1122  }
1123  }
1124  if( wandf > 0 && !moved && friendly == 0 ) { // No LOS, no scent, so as a fall-back follow sound
1125  unset_dest();
1126  if( wander_pos != get_location() ) {
1127  destination = here.getlocal( wander_pos );
1128  moved = true;
1129  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONMOVE, "%s follows sound to not use vision", name() );
1130  }
1131  }
1132 
1133  point new_d( destination.xy() - pos().xy() );
1134 
1135  // toggle facing direction for sdl flip
1136  if( !g->is_tileset_isometric() ) {
1137  if( new_d.x < 0 ) {
1138  facing = FacingDirection::LEFT;
1139  } else if( new_d.x > 0 ) {
1140  facing = FacingDirection::RIGHT;
1141  }
1142  } else {
1143  if( new_d.y <= 0 && new_d.x <= 0 ) {
1144  facing = FacingDirection::LEFT;
1145  }
1146  if( new_d.x >= 0 && new_d.y >= 0 ) {
1147  facing = FacingDirection::RIGHT;
1148  }
1149  }
1150 
1151  tripoint_abs_ms next_step;
1152  const bool can_open_doors = has_flag( mon_flag_CAN_OPEN_DOORS ) && !is_hallucination();
1153  const bool staggers = has_flag( mon_flag_STUMBLES );
1154  if( moved ) {
1155  // Implement both avoiding obstacles and staggering.
1156  moved = false;
1157  float switch_chance = 0.0f;
1158  const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
1159  // This is a float and using trig_dist() because that Does the Right Thing(tm)
1160  // in both circular and roguelike distance modes.
1161  const float distance_to_target = trig_dist( pos(), destination );
1162  for( tripoint &candidate : squares_closer_to( pos(), destination ) ) {
1163  // rare scenario when monster is on the border of the map and it's goal is outside of the map
1164  if( !here.inbounds( candidate ) ) {
1165  continue;
1166  }
1167 
1168  bool via_ramp = false;
1169  int rampPos = 0;
1170  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_UP, candidate ) ) {
1171  via_ramp = true;
1172  rampPos -= 1;
1173  candidate.z += 1;
1174  } else if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, candidate ) ) {
1175  via_ramp = true;
1176  rampPos += 1;
1177  candidate.z -= 1;
1178  }
1179  const tripoint_abs_ms candidate_abs = get_map().getglobal( candidate );
1180 
1181  if( candidate.z != posz() ) {
1182  bool can_z_move = true;
1183  if( !here.valid_move( pos(), candidate, false, true, via_ramp ) ) {
1184  // Can't phase through floor
1185  can_z_move = false;
1186  }
1187 
1188  // If we're trying to go up but can't fly, check if we can climb. If we can't, then don't
1189  // This prevents non-climb/fly enemies running up walls
1190  if( candidate.z > posz() && !( via_ramp || flies() ) ) {
1191  if( !can_climb() || !here.has_floor_or_support( candidate ) ) {
1192  if( ( !here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, pos() ) ||
1193  !here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, candidate ) ) ) {
1194  // Can't "jump" up a whole z-level
1195  can_z_move = false;
1196  }
1197  }
1198  }
1199 
1200  // Last chance - we can still do the z-level stair teleport bullshit that isn't removed yet
1201  // TODO: Remove z-level stair bullshit teleport after aligning all stairs
1202  if( !can_z_move &&
1203  posx() / ( SEEX * 2 ) == candidate.x / ( SEEX * 2 ) &&
1204  posy() / ( SEEY * 2 ) == candidate.y / ( SEEY * 2 ) ) {
1205  const tripoint upper = candidate.z > posz() ? candidate : pos();
1206  const tripoint lower = candidate.z > posz() ? pos() : candidate;
1207  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, upper ) &&
1208  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_UP, lower ) ) {
1209  can_z_move = true;
1210  }
1211  }
1212 
1213  if( !can_z_move ) {
1214  continue;
1215  }
1216  }
1217 
1218  // A flag to allow non-stumbling critters to stumble when the most direct choice is bad.
1219  bool bad_choice = false;
1220 
1221  const Creature *target = creatures.creature_at( candidate, is_hallucination() );
1222  if( target != nullptr ) {
1223  if( is_hallucination() != target->is_hallucination() && !target->is_avatar() ) {
1224  // Hallucinations should only be capable of targeting the player or other hallucinations.
1225  continue;
1226  }
1227  const Attitude att = attitude_to( *target );
1228  if( att == Attitude::HOSTILE ) {
1229  // When attacking an adjacent enemy, we're direct.
1230  moved = true;
1231  next_step = candidate_abs;
1232  break;
1233  }
1234  if( att == Attitude::FRIENDLY && ( target->is_avatar() || target->is_npc() ||
1235  target->has_flag( mon_flag_QUEEN ) ) ) {
1236  // Friendly firing the player or an NPC is illegal for gameplay reasons.
1237  // Monsters should instinctively avoid attacking queens that regenerate their own population.
1238  continue;
1239  }
1240  if( !has_flag( mon_flag_ATTACKMON ) && !has_flag( mon_flag_PUSH_MON ) ) {
1241  // Bail out if there's a non-hostile monster in the way and we're not pushy.
1242  continue;
1243  }
1244  // Friendly fire and pushing are always bad choices - they take a lot of time
1245  bad_choice = true;
1246  }
1247 
1248  // is there an openable door?
1249  if( can_open_doors &&
1250  here.open_door( *this, candidate, !here.is_outside( pos() ), true ) ) {
1251  moved = true;
1252  next_step = candidate_abs;
1253  continue;
1254  }
1255 
1256  // Try to shove vehicle out of the way
1257  shove_vehicle( destination, candidate );
1258  // Bail out if we can't move there and we can't bash.
1259  if( !pathed && !can_move_to( candidate ) ) {
1260  if( !can_bash ) {
1261  continue;
1262  }
1263  // Don't bash if we're just tracking a noise.
1264  if( !provocative_sound && is_wandering() && destination == here.getlocal( wander_pos ) ) {
1265  continue;
1266  }
1267  const int estimate = here.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), candidate );
1268  if( estimate <= 0 ) {
1269  continue;
1270  }
1271 
1272  if( estimate < 5 ) {
1273  bad_choice = true;
1274  }
1275  }
1276 
1277  const float progress = distance_to_target - trig_dist( tripoint( candidate.xy(),
1278  candidate.z + rampPos ), destination );
1279  // The x2 makes the first (and most direct) path twice as likely,
1280  // since the chance of switching is 1/1, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8
1281  switch_chance += progress * 2;
1282  // Randomly pick one of the viable squares to move to weighted by distance.
1283  if( progress > 0 && ( !moved || x_in_y( progress, switch_chance ) ) ) {
1284  moved = true;
1285  next_step = candidate_abs;
1286  // If we stumble, pick a random square, otherwise take the first one,
1287  // which is the most direct path.
1288  // Except if the direct path is bad, then check others
1289  // Or if the path is given by pathfinder
1290  if( !staggers && ( !bad_choice || pathed ) ) {
1291  break;
1292  }
1293  }
1294  }
1295  }
1296  // Finished logic section. By this point, we should have chosen a square to
1297  // move to (moved = true).
1298  if( moved ) { // Actual effects of moving to the square we've chosen
1299  const tripoint local_next_step = here.getlocal( next_step );
1300  const bool did_something =
1301  ( !pacified && attack_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1302  ( !pacified && can_open_doors &&
1303  here.open_door( *this, local_next_step, !here.is_outside( pos() ) ) ) ||
1304  ( !pacified && bash_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1305  ( !pacified && push_to( local_next_step, 0, 0 ) ) ||
1306  move_to( local_next_step, false, false, get_stagger_adjust( pos(), destination, local_next_step ) );
1307 
1308  if( !did_something ) {
1309  mod_moves( -get_speed() ); // If we don't do this, we'll get infinite loops.
1310  }
1311  if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) && dragged_foe != nullptr ) {
1312 
1313  if( !dragged_foe->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1314  dragged_foe = nullptr;
1315  remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1316  } else if( drag_to != get_location() && creatures.creature_at( drag_to ) == nullptr ) {
1317  dragged_foe->move_to( drag_to );
1318  }
1319  }
1320  } else {
1321  moves = 0;
1322  stumble();
1323  path.clear();
1324  }
1325  if( has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) ) {
1326  if( rl_dist( get_location(), player_character.get_location() ) > 2 ) {
1327  // Either failed to keep up with the player or moved away
1328  remove_effect( effect_led_by_leash );
1329  add_msg( m_info, _( "You lose hold of a leash." ) );
1330  }
1331  }
1332 }
