◆ move_effects()

bool monster::move_effects ( bool  attacking)
overridevirtual

Processes effects which may prevent the monster from moving (bear traps, crushed, etc.).

Returns false if movement is stopped.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 2205 of file monster.cpp.

2206 {
2207  // This function is relatively expensive, we want that cached
2208  // IMPORTANT: If adding any new effects here, make SURE to
2209  // add them to hardcoded_movement_impairing in effect.cpp
2210  if( !effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] ) {
2211  return true;
2212  }
2213 
2214  map &here = get_map();
2215  bool u_see_me = get_player_view().sees( *this );
2216  if( has_effect( effect_tied ) ) {
2217  // friendly pet, will stay tied down and obey.
2218  if( friendly == -1 ) {
2219  return false;
2220  }
2221  // non-friendly monster will struggle to get free occasionally.
2222  // some monsters can't be tangled up with a net/bolas/lasso etc.
2223  bool immediate_break = type->in_species( species_FISH ) || type->in_species( species_MOLLUSK ) ||
2224  type->in_species( species_ROBOT ) || type->bodytype == "snake" || type->bodytype == "blob";
2225  if( !immediate_break && rng( 0, 900 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
2226  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2227  add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to break free of its bonds." ), name() );
2228  }
2229  } else if( immediate_break ) {
2230  remove_effect( effect_tied );
2231  if( tied_item ) {
2232  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2233  add_msg( _( "The %s easily slips out of its bonds." ), name() );
2234  }
2235  here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
2236  tied_item.reset();
2237  }
2238  } else {
2239  if( tied_item ) {
2240  const bool broken = rng( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, std::min( 10000,
2241  type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 250 ) ) > 800;
2242  if( !broken ) {
2243  here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
2244  }
2245  tied_item.reset();
2246  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2247  if( broken ) {
2248  add_msg( _( "The %s snaps the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
2249  } else {
2250  add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
2251  }
2252  }
2253  }
2254  remove_effect( effect_tied );
2255  }
2256  return false;
2257  }
2258  if( has_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
2259  if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
2260  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2261  add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to stand." ), name() );
2262  }
2263  } else {
2264  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2265  add_msg( _( "The %s climbs to its feet!" ), name() );
2266  }
2267  remove_effect( effect_downed );
2268  }
2269  return false;
2270  }
2271  if( has_effect( effect_webbed ) ) {
2272  if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 6 * get_effect_int( effect_webbed ) ) ) {
2273  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2274  add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the webs!" ), name() );
2275  }
2276  remove_effect( effect_webbed );
2277  }
2278  return false;
2279  }
2280  if( has_effect( effect_lightsnare ) ) {
2281  if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 12 ) ) {
2282  remove_effect( effect_lightsnare );
2283  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2284  add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the light snare!" ), name() );
2285  }
2286  }
2287  return false;
2288  }
2289  if( has_effect( effect_heavysnare ) ) {
2290  if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 7 ) {
2291  if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 32 ) ) {
2292  remove_effect( effect_heavysnare );
2293  here.spawn_item( pos(), "rope_6" );
2294  here.spawn_item( pos(), "snare_trigger" );
2295  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2296  add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the heavy snare!" ), name() );
2297  }
2298  }
2299  }
2300  return false;
2301  }
2302  if( has_effect( effect_beartrap ) ) {
2303  if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 18 ) {
2304  if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 200 ) ) {
2305  remove_effect( effect_beartrap );
2306  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2307  add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the bear trap!" ), name() );
2308  }
2309  }
2310  }
2311  return false;
2312  }
2313  if( has_effect( effect_crushed ) ) {
2314  if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 100 ) ) {
2315  remove_effect( effect_crushed );
2316  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2317  add_msg( _( "The %s frees itself from the rubble!" ), name() );
2318  }
2319  }
2320  return false;
2321  }
2322  if( has_effect( effect_worked_on ) ) {
2323  return false;
2324  }
2325 
2326  // If we ever get more effects that force movement on success this will need to be reworked to
2327  // only trigger success effects if /all/ rolls succeed
2328  if( has_effect( effect_in_pit ) ) {
2329  if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides ) {
2330  return false;
2331  } else {
2332  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2333  add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the pit!" ), name() );
2334  }
2335  remove_effect( effect_in_pit );
2336  }
2337  }
2338  if( has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {
2339  // Pretty hacky, but monsters have no stats
2340  map &here = get_map();
2341  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
2342  const tripoint_range<tripoint> &surrounding = here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 );
2343  for( const effect &grab : get_effects_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {
2344  // Is our grabber around?
2345  monster *grabber = nullptr;
2346  for( const tripoint loc : surrounding ) {
2347  monster *mon = creatures.creature_at<monster>( loc );
2348  if( mon && mon->has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB_FILTER ) ) {
2349  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MATTACK, "Grabber %s found", mon->name() );
2350  grabber = mon;
2351  break;
2352  }
2353  }
2354 
2355  if( grabber == nullptr ) {
2356  remove_effect( grab.get_id() );
2357  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MATTACK, "Orphan grab found and removed" );
2358  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2359  add_msg( _( "The %s is no longer grabbed!" ), name() );
2360  }
2361  continue;
2362  }
2363  int monster = type->melee_skill + type->melee_damage.total_damage();
2364  int grab_str = get_effect_int( grab.get_id() );
2365  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s attempting to break grab %s, success %d in intensity %d",
2366  get_name(), grab.get_id().c_str(), monster, grabber );
2367  if( !x_in_y( monster, grab_str ) ) {
2368  return false;
2369  } else {
2370  if( u_see_me && get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS" ) ) {
2371  add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free from the %s's grab!" ), name(), grabber->name() );
2372  }
2373  remove_effect( grab.get_id() );
2374  }
2375  }
2376  }
2377  return true;
2378 }

◆ move_to()

bool monster::move_to ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  force = false,
bool  step_on_critter = false,
float  stagger_adjustment = 1.0 
)

Attempt to move to p.

If there's something blocking the movement, such as infinite move costs at the target, an existing NPC or monster, this function simply aborts and does nothing.

Parameters
pDestination of movement
forceIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently something, else than a creature, blocking the destination.
step_on_critterIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently a creature blocking the destination.
stagger_adjustmentis a multiplier for move cost to compensate for staggering.
Returns
true if movement successful, false otherwise

Definition at line 1852 of file monmove.cpp.

1854 {
1855  const bool on_ground = !digging() && !flies();
1856 
1857  const bool z_move = p.z != pos().z;
1858  const bool going_up = p.z > pos().z;
1859 
1860  tripoint destination = p;
1861  map &here = get_map();
1862 
1863  // This is stair teleportation hackery.
1864  // TODO: Remove this in favor of stair alignment
1865  if( going_up ) {
1866  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_UP, pos() ) ) {
1867  destination = find_closest_stair( p, ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_DOWN );
1868  }
1869  } else if( z_move ) {
1870  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) ) {
1871  destination = find_closest_stair( p, ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_UP );
1872  }
1873  }
1874

1876  return false;
1877  }
1878

1880  Creature *critter = get_creature_tracker().creature_at( destination, is_hallucination() );
1881  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, destination ) ) {
1882  if( here.impassable( destination ) && critter == nullptr ) {
1883  if( flies() ) {
1884  mod_moves( -get_speed() );
1885  force = true;
1886  if( get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVEMENT" ) ) {
1887  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, _( "The %1$s flies over the %2$s." ), name(),
1888  here.has_flag_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, p ) ? here.furnname( p ) :
1889  here.tername( p ) );
1890  }
1891  } else if( climbs() ) {
1892  mod_moves( -get_speed() * 1.5 );
1893  force = true;
1894  if( get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVEMENT" ) ) {
1895  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, _( "The %1$s climbs over the %2$s." ), name(),
1896  here.has_flag_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, p ) ? here.furnname( p ) :
1897  here.tername( p ) );
1898  }
1899  }
1900  }
1901  }
1902 
1903  if( critter != nullptr && !step_on_critter ) {
1904  return false;
1905  }
1906 
1907  // Make sure that we can move there, unless force is true.
1908  if( !force && !can_move_to( destination ) ) {
1909  return false;
1910  }
1911 
1912  if( !force ) {
1913  // This adjustment is to make it so that monster movement speed relative to the player
1914  // is consistent even if the monster stumbles,
1915  // and the same regardless of the distance measurement mode.
1916  // Note: Keep this as float here or else it will cancel valid moves
1917  const float cost = stagger_adjustment *
1918  static_cast<float>( climbs() &&
1919  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ? calc_climb_cost( pos(),
1920  destination ) : calc_movecost( pos(),
1921  destination ) );
1922  if( cost > 0.0f ) {
1923  mod_moves( -static_cast<int>( std::ceil( cost ) ) );
1924  } else {
1925  return false;
1926  }
1927  }
1928 
1929  //Check for moving into/out of water
1930  bool was_water = underwater;
1931  bool will_be_water =
1932  on_ground && (
1933  // AQUATIC monsters always "swim under" the vehicles, while other swimming monsters are forced to surface
1934  has_flag( mon_flag_AQUATIC ) || ( can_submerge() && !here.veh_at( destination ) )
1935  ) && here.is_divable( destination );
1936 
1937  if( get_option<bool>( "LOG_MONSTER_MOVEMENT" ) ) {
1938  //Birds and other flying creatures flying over the deep water terrain
1939  if( was_water && flies() ) {
1940  if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
1941  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, m_warning, _( "A %1$s flies over the %2$s!" ),
1942  name(), here.tername( pos() ) );
1943  }
1944  } else if( was_water && !will_be_water ) {
1945  // Use more dramatic messages for swimming monsters
1946  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, m_warning,
1947  //~ Message when a monster emerges from water
1948  //~ %1$s: monster name, %2$s: leaps/emerges, %3$s: terrain name

1951  has_flag( mon_flag_AQUATIC ) ? _( "leaps" ) : _( "emerges" ), here.tername( pos() ) );
1952  } else if( !was_water && will_be_water ) {
1953  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, m_warning, pgettext( "monster movement",
1954  //~ Message when a monster enters water

1963  if( vp_orig ) {

1972  vp_dest->vehicle().invalidate_mass();
1973  }
1974  if( is_hallucination() ) {
1975  //Hallucinations don't do any of the stuff after this point

1982  } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {

1996  if( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SHARP, pos() ) && !one_in( 4 ) &&

1998  apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), sharp_damage );
1999  }

2002  apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), rough_damage );
2003  }
2004  }
2005  here.creature_on_trap( *this );
2006  if( is_dead() ) {
2007  return true;
2008  }
2009  }
2010  if( !will_be_water && ( digs() || can_dig() ) ) {
2011  underwater = here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DIGGABLE, pos() );
2012  }
2013 
2014  // Digging creatures leave a trail of churned earth
2015  // They always leave some on their tile, and larger creatures emit some around themselves as well

2019  case creature_size::medium:
2020  factor = 4;
2021  break;
2022  case creature_size::large:
2023  factor = 3;
2024  break;
2025  case creature_size::huge:
2026  factor = 2;
2027  break;
2028  case creature_size::num_sizes:
2029  debugmsg( "ERROR: Invalid Creature size class." );
2030  break;
2031  default:
2032  factor = 4;
2033  break;
2034  }

2036  for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 ) ) {

2038  here.add_field( dest, fd_churned_earth, 2 );
2039  }
2040  }
2041  }
2042 
2043  // Acid trail monsters leave... a trail of acid
2044  if( has_flag( mon_flag_ACIDTRAIL ) ) {
2045  here.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
2046  }
2047 
2048  // Not all acid trail monsters leave as much acid. Every time this monster takes a step, there is a 1/5 chance it will drop a puddle.
2049  if( has_flag( mon_flag_SHORTACIDTRAIL ) ) {
2050  if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
2051  here.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
2052  }
2053  }
2054

2057  const int fstr = 3 - ( std::abs( sludge_p.x - posx() ) + std::abs( sludge_p.y - posy() ) );

2067  }

2076  here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( "napalm", calendar::turn, 50 ) );
2077  ammo[itype_pressurized_tank] -= 50;
2078  } else {

2081  }
2082  }
2083  }

bool monster::movement_impaired ( )

◆ on_load()

void monster::on_load ( )

Retroactively update monster.

Call this after a preexisting monster has been placed on map. Don't call for monsters that have been freshly created, it may cause the monster to upgrade itself into another monster type.

3892  morale += adjust_by_m;
3893  } else {

3895  }

3901  std::abs( morale - type->morale ) );
3902  } else {
3903  morale -= std::min( ( dt_left_m / 8 ),
3904  std::abs( morale - type->morale ) );
3905  }
3906  }
3907  if( anger != type->agro ) {

3911  const int adjust_by_a = std::min( ( dt_left_a / 4 ),
3912  ( std::abs( anger - type->agro ) - 15 ) );
3913  dt_left_a -= adjust_by_a * 4;
3914  if( anger < type->agro ) {
3915  anger += adjust_by_a;
3916  } else {
3917  anger -= adjust_by_a;
3918  }
3919  }
3920

3922  anger -= std::min( static_cast<int>( std::ceil( dt_left_a / 8.0 ) ),
3923  std::abs( anger - type->agro ) );
3924  } else {
3925  anger += std::min( ( dt_left_a / 8 ),
3926  std::abs( anger - type->agro ) );
3927  }

3931  aggro_character = false;
3932  }
3933  }
3934

3936  float regen = type->regenerates;
3937  if( regen <= 0 ) {
3938  if( has_flag( mon_flag_REVIVES ) && !has_flag( mon_flag_DORMANT ) ) {
3939  regen = 0.02f * type->hp / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3940  } else if( made_of( material_flesh ) || made_of( material_iflesh ) ||
3941  made_of( material_veggy ) ) {
3942  // Most living stuff here
3943  regen = 0.005f * type->hp / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3944  }
3945  }
3946  const int heal_amount = roll_remainder( regen * to_turns<int>( dt ) );
3947  const int healed = heal( heal_amount );
3948  int healed_speed = 0;
3949  if( get_speed_base() < type->speed ) {
3950  const int old_speed = get_speed_base();
3951  if( hp >= type->hp ) {
3952  set_speed_base( type->speed );
3953  } else {
3954  const int speed_delta = std::max( healed * type->speed / type->hp, 1 );
3955  set_speed_base( std::min( old_speed + speed_delta, type->speed ) );
3956  }
3957  healed_speed = get_speed_base() - old_speed;
3958  }
3959 
3960  // Update special attacks' cooldown
3961  for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {
3962  const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;
3963  const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
3964  if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
3965  continue;
3966  }
3967  mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
3968  if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
3969  continue;
3970  }
3971 
3972  if( local_attack_data.cooldown > 0 ) {
3973  local_attack_data.cooldown = std::max( 0, local_attack_data.cooldown - to_turns<int>( dt ) );
3974  }
3975  }
3976 
3977  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "on_load() by %s, %d turns, healed %d hp, %d speed",

518 {
519  monster_plan mon_plan( *this );

523  monster_attitude mood = attitude();

526  if( friendly == 0 && seen_levels.test( player_character.pos().z + OVERMAP_DEPTH ) &&
527  sees( player_character ) ) {
528  mon_plan.dist = rate_target( player_character, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
529  mon_plan.fleeing = mon_plan.fleeing || is_fleeing( player_character );
530  mon_plan.target = &player_character;
531  if( !mon_plan.fleeing && anger <= 20 ) {
532  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_seen;
533  }
534 
535  anger_hostile_seen( mon_plan );
536 
537  if( mon_plan.dist <= 5 ) {
538  if( anger <= 30 ) {
539  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_near;
540  }
541  if( mon_plan.angers_hostile_near && x_in_y( anger, 100 ) ) {
542  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s's character aggro triggered by proximity", name() );
543  aggro_character = true;
544  }
545  morale -= mon_plan.fears_hostile_near;
546  anger_mating_season( mon_plan );
547  }
548  anger_cub_threatened( mon_plan );
549  } else if( friendly != 0 && !mon_plan.docile ) {
550  for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
551  if( tmp.friendly == 0 && tmp.attitude_to( *this ) == Attitude::HOSTILE &&
552  seen_levels.test( tmp.pos().z + OVERMAP_DEPTH ) ) {
553  float rating = rate_target( tmp, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
554  if( rating < mon_plan.dist ) {
555  mon_plan.target = &tmp;
556  mon_plan.dist = rating;
557  }
558  }
559  }
560  }
561 
562  if( mon_plan.docile ) {
563  if( friendly != 0 && mon_plan.target != nullptr ) {
564  set_dest( mon_plan.target->get_location() );
565  }
566 
567  return;
568  }
569 
570  int valid_targets = ( mon_plan.target == nullptr ) ? 0 : 1;
571  for( npc &who : g->all_npcs() ) {
572  mf_attitude faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( who.get_monster_faction() );
573  if( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
574  continue;
575  }
576  if( !seen_levels.test( who.pos().z + OVERMAP_DEPTH ) ) {
577  continue;
578  }
579 
580  float rating = rate_target( who, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
581  bool fleeing_from = is_fleeing( who );
582  if( rating == mon_plan.dist && ( mon_plan.fleeing || attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ||
583  attitude( &who ) == MATT_FOLLOW ) ) {
584  ++valid_targets;
585  if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
586  mon_plan.target = &who;
587  }
588  }
589  // Switch targets if closer and hostile or scarier than current target
590  if( ( rating < mon_plan.dist && mon_plan.fleeing ) ||
591  ( faction_att == MFA_HATE ) ||
592  ( rating < mon_plan.dist && attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ) ||
593  ( !mon_plan.fleeing && fleeing_from ) ) {
594  mon_plan.target = &who;
595  mon_plan.dist = rating;
596  valid_targets = 1;
597  }
598  mon_plan.fleeing = mon_plan.fleeing || fleeing_from;
599  if( rating <= 5 ) {
600  if( anger <= 30 ) {
601  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_near;
602  }
603  if( mon_plan.angers_hostile_near && x_in_y( anger, 100 ) ) {
604  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s's character aggro triggered by proximity to %s", name(),
605  who.name );
606  aggro_character = true;
607  }
608  morale -= mon_plan.fears_hostile_near;
609  anger_mating_season( mon_plan );
610  }
611  if( !mon_plan.fleeing && anger <= 20 && valid_targets != 0 ) {
612  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_seen;
613  }
614  if( !mon_plan.fleeing && valid_targets != 0 ) {
615  morale -= mon_plan.fears_hostile_seen;
616  anger_hostile_seen( mon_plan );
617  }
618  }
619 
620  mon_plan.fleeing = mon_plan.fleeing || ( mood == MATT_FLEE );
621  // Throttle monster thinking, if there are no apparent threats, stop paying attention.
622  constexpr int max_turns_for_rate_limiting = 1800;
623  constexpr double max_turns_to_skip = 600.0;
624  // Outputs a range from 0.0 - 1.0.
625  float rate_limiting_factor = 1.0 - logarithmic_range( 0, max_turns_for_rate_limiting,
626  turns_since_target );
627  int turns_to_skip = max_turns_to_skip * rate_limiting_factor;
628  creature_tracker &tracker = get_creature_tracker();
629  if( friendly == 0 && ( turns_to_skip == 0 || turns_since_target % turns_to_skip == 0 ) ) {
630  tracker.for_each_reachable( *this, [this]( const mfaction_id & other ) {
631  const mf_attitude faction_att = faction->attitude( other );
632  return !( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY );
633  },
634  [this, &seen_levels, &mon_plan, &valid_targets]( Creature * other ) {
635  if( !seen_levels.test( other->posz() + OVERMAP_DEPTH ) ) {
636  return;
637  }
638  monster *mon_ptr = dynamic_cast<monster *>( other );
639  if( mon_ptr == nullptr ) {
640  return;
641  }
642  monster &mon = *mon_ptr;
643  float rating = rate_target( mon, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
644  if( rating == mon_plan.dist ) {
645  ++valid_targets;
646  if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
647  mon_plan.target = &mon;
648  }
649  }
650  if( rating < mon_plan.dist ) {
651  mon_plan.target = &mon;
652  mon_plan.dist = rating;
653  valid_targets = 1;
654  }
655  if( rating <= 5 ) {
656  if( anger <= 30 ) {
657  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_near;
658  }
659  morale -= mon_plan.fears_hostile_near;
660  }
661  if( !mon_plan.fleeing && anger <= 20 && valid_targets != 0 ) {
662  anger += mon_plan.angers_hostile_seen;
663  }
664  if( !mon_plan.fleeing && valid_targets != 0 ) {
665  morale -= mon_plan.fears_hostile_seen;
666  }
667  } );
668  }
669  if( mon_plan.target == nullptr ) {
670  // Just avoiding overflow.
671  turns_since_target = std::min( turns_since_target + 1, max_turns_for_rate_limiting );
672  } else {
673  turns_since_target = 0;
674  }
675 
676  // Friendly monsters here
677  // Avoid for hordes of same-faction stuff or it could get expensive
678  const mfaction_id actual_faction = friendly == 0 ? faction : STATIC( mfaction_str_id( "player" ) );
679  mon_plan.swarms = mon_plan.swarms && mon_plan.target == nullptr; // Only swarm if we have no target
680  if( mon_plan.group_morale || mon_plan.swarms ) {
681  tracker.for_each_reachable( *this, [actual_faction]( const mfaction_id & other ) {
682  return actual_faction == other;
683  },
684  [this, &seen_levels, &mon_plan]( Creature * other ) {
685  if( !seen_levels.test( other->posz() + OVERMAP_DEPTH ) ) {
686  return;
687  }
688  monster *mon_ptr = dynamic_cast<monster *>( other );
689  if( mon_ptr == nullptr ) {
690  return;
691  }
692  monster &mon = *mon_ptr;
693  float rating = rate_target( mon, mon_plan.dist, mon_plan.smart_planning );
694  if( mon_plan.group_morale && rating <= 10 ) {
695  morale += 10 - rating;
696  }
697  if( mon_plan.swarms ) {
698  if( rating < 5 ) { // Too crowded here
699  wander_pos = get_location();
700  while( wander_pos == get_location() ) {
701  wander_pos += point( rng( -3, 3 ), rng( -3, 3 ) );
702  }
703  wandf = 2;
704  mon_plan.target = nullptr;
705  // Swarm to the furthest ally you can see
706  } else if( rating < FLT_MAX && rating > mon_plan.dist && wandf <= 0 ) {
707  mon_plan.target = &mon;
708  mon_plan.dist = rating;
709  }
710  }
711  } );
712  }
713 
714  // Operating monster keep you safe while they operate, how nice....
715  if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
716  if( has_effect( effect_operating ) ) {
717  friendly = 100;
718  for( Creature *critter : here.get_creatures_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
719  monster *mon = dynamic_cast<monster *>( critter );
720  if( mon != nullptr && mon->type->in_species( species_ZOMBIE ) ) {
721  anger = 100;
722  } else {
723  anger = 0;
724  }
725  }
726  }
727  }
728 
729  if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
730 
731  if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
732 
733  bool found_path_to_couch = false;
734  tripoint tmp( pos() + point( 12, 12 ) );
735  tripoint couch_loc;
736  for( const tripoint &couch_pos : here.find_furnitures_with_flag_in_radius( pos(), 10,
737  ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_AUTODOC_COUCH ) ) {
738  if( here.clear_path( pos(), couch_pos, 10, 0, 100 ) ) {
739  if( rl_dist( pos(), couch_pos ) < rl_dist( pos(), tmp ) ) {
740  tmp = couch_pos;
741  found_path_to_couch = true;
742  couch_loc = couch_pos;
743  }
744  }
745  }
746 
747  if( !found_path_to_couch ) {
748  anger = 0;
749  remove_effect( effect_dragging );
750  } else {
751  set_dest( here.getglobal( couch_loc ) );
752  }
753  }
754 
755  } else if( mon_plan.target != nullptr ) {
756 
757  const tripoint_abs_ms dest = mon_plan.target->get_location();
758  Creature::Attitude att_to_target = attitude_to( *mon_plan.target );
759  if( att_to_target == Attitude::HOSTILE && !mon_plan.fleeing ) {
760  set_dest( dest );
761  } else if( mon_plan.fleeing ) {
762  tripoint_abs_ms away = get_location() - dest + get_location();
763  away.z() = posz();
764  set_dest( away );
765  }
766  if( ( mon_plan.angers_hostile_weak || mon_plan.fears_hostile_weak ||
767  mon_plan.placate_hostile_weak ) &&
768  att_to_target != Attitude::FRIENDLY ) {
769  int hp_per = mon_plan.target->hp_percentage();
770  if( hp_per <= 70 ) {
771  if( mon_plan.angers_hostile_weak && anger <= 40 ) {
772  anger += 10 - static_cast<int>( hp_per / 10 );
773  if( x_in_y( anger, 100 ) ) {
774  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MONSTER, "%s's character aggro triggered by %s's weakness", name(),
775  mon_plan.target->disp_name() );
776  aggro_character = true;
777  }
778  } else if( mon_plan.fears_hostile_weak ) {
779  morale -= 10 - static_cast<int>( hp_per / 10 );
780  } else if( mon_plan.placate_hostile_weak ) {
781  anger -= 10 - static_cast<int>( hp_per / 10 );
782  }
783  }
784  }
785  } else if( !patrol_route.empty() ) {
786  // If we have a patrol route and no target, find the current step on the route
787  tripoint_abs_ms next_stop = patrol_route.at( next_patrol_point );
788 
789  // if there is more than one patrol point, advance to the next one if we're almost there
790  // this handles impassable obstacles but patrollers can still get stuck
791  if( ( patrol_route.size() > 1 ) && rl_dist( next_stop, get_location() ) < 2 ) {
792  next_patrol_point = ( next_patrol_point + 1 ) % patrol_route.size();
793  next_stop = patrol_route.at( next_patrol_point );
794  }
795  set_dest( next_stop );
796  } else if( friendly != 0 && has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) &&
797  get_location().z() == get_dest().z() ) {
798  // visibility doesn't matter, we're getting pulled by a leash
799  // To use stairs smoothly, if the destination is on a different Z-level, move there first.
800  set_dest( player_character.get_location() );
801  if( friendly > 0 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
802  // Grow restless with no targets
803  friendly--;
804  }
805  } else if( friendly > 0 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
806  // Grow restless with no targets
807  friendly--;
808  } else if( is_pet_follow() && sees( player_character ) &&
809  ( get_location().z() == player_character.get_location().z() ||
810  get_location().z() == get_dest().z() ) ) {
811  // Simpleminded animals are too dumb to follow the player.
812  // To use stairs smoothly, if the destination is on a different Z-level, move there first.
813  set_dest( player_character.get_location() );
814  }
815 }

◆ print_info()

int monster::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Implements Creature.

890  vStart += fold_and_print( w, point( column, vStart ), max_width, c_white, oss.str() );
891 
892  Character &pc = get_player_character();
893  bool sees_player = sees( pc );
894  const bool player_knows = !pc.has_trait( trait_INATTENTIVE );
895 
896  // Hostility indicator on the second line.
897  std::pair<std::string, nc_color> att = get_attitude();
898  if( player_knows ) {
899  mvwprintz( w, point( column, vStart++ ), att.second, att.first );
900  }
901 
902  // Awareness indicator in the third line.
903  std::string senses_str = sees_player ? _( "Can see to your current location" ) :
904  _( "Can't see to your current location" );
905 
906  if( player_knows ) {
907  vStart += fold_and_print( w, point( column, vStart ), max_width, player_knows &&
908  sees_player ? c_red : c_green,
909  senses_str );
910  }
911 
912  const std::string speed_desc = speed_description(
913  speed_rating(),
914  has_flag( mon_flag_IMMOBILE ),
915  type->speed_desc );
916  vStart += fold_and_print( w, point( column, vStart ), max_width, c_white, speed_desc );
917 
918  // Monster description on following lines.
919  std::vector<std::string> lines = foldstring( type->get_description(), max_width );
920  int numlines = lines.size();
921  for( int i = 0; i < numlines && vStart < vEnd; i++ ) {
922  mvwprintz( w, point( column, vStart++ ), c_light_gray, lines[i] );
923  }
924 
925  if( !mission_fused.empty() ) {
926  // Mission monsters fused into this monster
927  const std::string fused_desc = string_format( _( "Parts of %s protrude from its body." ),
928  enumerate_as_string( mission_fused ) );
929  lines = foldstring( fused_desc, max_width );
930  numlines = lines.size();
931  for( int i = 0; i < numlines && vStart < vEnd; i++ ) {
932  mvwprintz( w, point( column, ++vStart ), c_light_gray, lines[i] );
933  }
934  }
935 
936  // Riding indicator on next line after description.
937  if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && mounted_player ) {
938  mvwprintz( w, point( column, ++vStart ), c_white, _( "Rider: %s" ), mounted_player->disp_name() );
939  }
940 
941  // Show monster size on the last line
942  if( size_bonus > 0 ) {
943  mvwprintz( w, point( column, ++vStart ), c_light_gray, _( " It is %s." ),
944  size_names.at( get_size() ) );
945  }
946 
947  if( get_option<bool>( "ENABLE_ASCII_ART" ) ) {
948  const ascii_art_id art = type->get_picture_id();
949  if( art.is_valid() ) {
950  for( const std::string &line : art->picture ) {
951  fold_and_print( w, point( column, ++vStart ), max_width, c_white, line );
952  }
953  }
954  }
955  return ++vStart;
956 }

3251  const float dHP = 50.0 * std::exp( - light * light / 10000 );

3297  morale = std::min( morale, type->morale );

3372  vehicle_stack contents = veh.get_items( *part );
3373  const vpart_info &vpinfo = part->info();
3374  if( !vp.part_with_feature( "CARGO_PASSABLE", false ) ) {
3375  capacity += vpinfo.size;
3376  free_cargo += contents.free_volume();
3377  }
3378  }
3379  const creature_size size = get_size();
3380  if( capacity > 0_ml ) {
3381  // Open-topped vehicle parts have more room, and are always free space for fliers.
3382  if( !veh.enclosed_at( z_pos ) ) {
3383  free_cargo *= 1.2;
3384  if( flies() ) {
3385  remove_effect( effect_cramped_space );
3386  return;
3387  }
3388  }
3389  if( ( size == creature_size::tiny && free_cargo < 15625_ml ) ||
3390  ( size == creature_size::small && free_cargo < 31250_ml ) ||
3391  ( size == creature_size::medium && free_cargo < 62500_ml ) ||
3392  ( size == creature_size::large && free_cargo < 125000_ml ) ||
3393  ( size == creature_size::huge && free_cargo < 250000_ml ) ) {
3394  if( !has_effect( effect_cramped_space ) ) {
3395  add_effect( effect_cramped_space, 2_turns, true );
3396  }
3397  return;
3398  }
3399  }

void monster::process_one_effect ( effect &  it,

)
overrideprotectedvirtual

Processes monster-specific effects of an effect.

Implements Creature.

3112 {
3113  // Monsters don't get trait-based reduction, but they do get effect based reduction
3114  bool reduced = resists_effect( it );
3115  const auto get_effect = [&it, is_new]( const std::string & arg, bool reduced ) {
3116  if( is_new ) {
3117  return it.get_amount( arg, reduced );
3118  }
3119  return it.get_mod( arg, reduced );
3120  };
3121

3129  int val = get_effect( "HURT", reduced );

3131  if( is_new || it.activated( calendar::turn, "HURT", val, reduced, 1 ) ) {
3132  apply_damage( it.get_source().resolve_creature(), bodypart_id( "torso" ), val );
3133  }
3134  }
3135 
3136  const efftype_id &id = it.get_id();
3137  // TODO: MATERIALS use fire resistance
3138  if( it.impairs_movement() ) {
3139  effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] = true;
3140  } else if( id == effect_onfire ) {
3141  int dam = 0;
3142  if( made_of( material_veggy ) ) {
3143  dam = rng( 10, 20 );
3144  } else if( made_of( material_flesh ) || made_of( material_iflesh ) ) {
3145  dam = rng( 5, 10 );
3146  }
3147

3149  if( dam > 0 ) {
3150  apply_damage( it.get_source().resolve_creature(), bodypart_id( "torso" ), dam );
3151  } else {
3152  it.set_duration( 0_turns );
3153  }
3154  } else if( id == effect_run ) {
3155  effect_cache[FLEEING] = true;
3156  } else if( id == effect_no_sight || id == effect_blind ) {
3157  effect_cache[VISION_IMPAIRED] = true;
3158  } else if( ( id == effect_bleed || id == effect_dripping_mechanical_fluid ) &&
3159  x_in_y( it.get_intensity(), it.get_max_intensity() ) ) {
3160  // this is for balance only
3161  it.mod_duration( -rng( 1_turns, it.get_int_dur_factor() / 2 ) );
3162  bleed();
3163  if( id == effect_bleed ) {
3164  // monsters are simplified so they just take damage from bleeding
3165  apply_damage( it.get_source().resolve_creature(), bodypart_id( "torso" ), 1 );
3166  }
3167  } else if( id == effect_fake_common_cold ) {
3168  if( calendar::once_every( time_duration::from_seconds( rng( 30, 300 ) ) ) && one_in( 2 ) ) {
3169  sounds::sound( pos(), 4, sounds::sound_t::speech, _( "a hacking cough." ), false, "misc", "cough" );
3170  }
3171 
3172  avatar &you = get_avatar(); // No NPCs for now.
3173  if( rl_dist( pos(), you.pos() ) <= 1 ) {
3174  you.get_sick( false );
3175  }
3176  } else if( id == effect_fake_flu ) {
3177  // Need to define the two separately because it's theoretically (and realistically) possible to have both flu and cold at once, both for players and monsters.
3178  if( calendar::once_every( time_duration::from_seconds( rng( 30, 300 ) ) ) && one_in( 2 ) ) {
3179  sounds::sound( pos(), 4, sounds::sound_t::speech, _( "a hacking cough." ), false, "misc", "cough" );
3180  }
3181 
3182  avatar &you = get_avatar(); // No NPCs for now.
3183  if( rl_dist( pos(), you.pos() ) <= 1 ) {
3184  you.get_sick( true );
3185  }
3186  }
3187

3189  enchantment_cache->clear();
3190

3194  if( ench.is_active( *this ) && ench.is_monster_relevant() ) {
3195  enchantment_cache->force_add( ench, *this );

3197  }

2632  if( !calendar::once_every( e.second ) ) {
2633  continue;
2634  }
2635  const emit_id emid = e.first;
2636  if( emid == emit_emit_shock_cloud ) {
2637  if( has_effect( effect_emp ) ) {
2638  continue; // don't emit electricity while EMPed
2639  } else if( has_effect( effect_supercharged ) ) {

2643  }

2649  // Loop through the monster's special attacks, same as monster::move.

2651  const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;

2653  if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
2654  continue;
2655  }
2656  mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
2657  if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
2658  continue;

2661  if( local_attack_data.cooldown > 0 ) {
2662  local_attack_data.cooldown--;

2671  if( you && you->has_effect_with_flag( json_flag_GRAB ) ) {

2673  you->get_name() );
2674  remove = false;
2675  }
2676  }

2683  }
2684  }

2715  }

◆ push_to()

bool monster::push_to ( const tripoint &  p,
int  boost,
size_t  depth 
)

Try to push away whatever occupies p, then step in.

May recurse and try to make the creature at p push further.

Parameters
pLocation of pushed object
boostA bonus on the roll to represent a horde pushing from behind
depthNumber of recursions so far
Returns
True if we managed to push something and took its place, false otherwise.

Definition at line 2094 of file monmove.cpp.

2095 {
2096  if( is_hallucination() ) {
2097  // Don't let hallucinations push, not even other hallucinations
2098  return false;
2099  }
2100 
2101  if( !has_flag( mon_flag_PUSH_MON ) || depth > 2 || has_effect( effect_pushed ) ) {
2102  return false;
2103  }
2104 
2105  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
2106  // TODO: Generalize this to Creature
2107  monster *const critter = creatures.creature_at<monster>( p );
2108  if( critter == nullptr || critter == this ||
2109  p == pos() || critter->movement_impaired() ) {
2110  return false;
2111  }
2112 
2113  if( !can_move_to( p ) ) {
2114  return false;
2115  }
2116 
2117  if( critter->is_hallucination() ) {
2118  // Kill the hallu, but return false so that the regular move_to is uses instead
2119  critter->die( nullptr );
2120  return false;
2121  }
2122 
2123  // Stability roll of the pushed critter
2124  const int defend = critter->stability_roll();
2125  // Stability roll of the pushing zed
2126  const int attack = stability_roll() + boost;
2127  if( defend > attack ) {
2128  return false;
2129  }
2130 
2131  map &here = get_map();
2132  const int movecost_from = 50 * here.move_cost( p );
2133  const int movecost_attacker = std::max( movecost_from, 200 - 10 * ( attack - defend ) );
2134  const tripoint dir = p - pos();
2135 
2136  // Mark self as pushed to simplify recursive pushing
2137  add_effect( effect_pushed, 1_turns );
2138 
2139  for( size_t i = 0; i < 6; i++ ) {
2140  const point d( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) );
2141  if( d.x == 0 && d.y == 0 ) {
2142  continue;
2143  }
2144 
2145  // Pushing forward is easier than pushing aside
2146  const int direction_penalty = std::abs( d.x - dir.x ) + std::abs( d.y - dir.y );
2147  if( direction_penalty > 2 ) {
2148  continue;
2149  }
2150 
2151  tripoint dest( p + d );
2152  const int dest_movecost_from = 50 * here.move_cost( dest );
2153 
2154  // Pushing into cars/windows etc. is harder
2155  const int movecost_penalty = here.move_cost( dest ) - 2;
2156  if( movecost_penalty <= -2 ) {
2157  // Can't push into unpassable terrain
2158  continue;
2159  }
2160 
2161  int roll = attack - ( defend + direction_penalty + movecost_penalty );
2162  if( roll < 0 ) {
2163  continue;
2164  }
2165 
2166  Creature *critter_recur = creatures.creature_at( dest );
2167  if( !( critter_recur == nullptr || critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) ) {
2168  // Try to push recursively
2169  monster *mon_recur = dynamic_cast< monster * >( critter_recur );
2170  if( mon_recur == nullptr ) {
2171  continue;
2172  }
2173 
2174  if( critter->push_to( dest, roll, depth + 1 ) ) {
2175  // The tile isn't necessarily free, need to check
2176  if( !creatures.creature_at( p ) ) {
2177  move_to( p );
2178  }
2179 
2180  mod_moves( -movecost_attacker );
2181 
2182  // Don't knock down a creature that successfully
2183  // pushed another creature, just reduce moves
2184  critter->mod_moves( -dest_movecost_from );
2185  return true;
2186  } else {
2187  return false;
2188  }
2189  }
2190 
2191  critter_recur = creatures.creature_at( dest );
2192  if( critter_recur != nullptr ) {
2193  if( critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) {
2194  critter_recur->die( nullptr );
2195  }
2196  } else if( !critter->has_flag( mon_flag_IMMOBILE ) ) {
2197  critter->setpos( dest );
2198  move_to( p );
2199  mod_moves( -movecost_attacker );
2200  critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
2201  }
2202  return true;
2203  }
2204 
2205  // Try to trample over a much weaker zed (or one with worse rolls)
2206  // Don't allow trampling with boost
2207  if( boost > 0 || attack < 2 * defend ) {
2208  return false;
2209  }
2210 
2211  g->swap_critters( *critter, *this );
2212  critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, rng( 0_turns, 2_turns ) );
2213  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
2214  // Only print the message when near player or it can get spammy
2215  if( rl_dist( player_character.pos(), pos() ) < 4 ) {
2216  add_msg_if_player_sees( *critter, m_warning, _( "The %1$s tramples %2$s." ),
2217  name(), critter->disp_name() );
2218  }
2219 
2220  mod_moves( -movecost_attacker );
2221  if( movecost_from > 100 ) {
2222  critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
2223  } else {
2224  critter->mod_moves( -movecost_from );
2225  }
2226 
2227  return true;
2228 }

◆ rate_target()

float monster::rate_target ( Creature &  c,

) const

Definition at line 361 of file monmove.cpp.

362 {
363  const FastDistanceApproximation d = rl_dist_fast( pos(), c.pos() );
364  if( d <= 0 ) {
365  return FLT_MAX;
366  }
367 
368  // Check a very common and cheap case first
369  if( !smart && d >= best ) {
370  return FLT_MAX;
371  }
372 
373  if( !sees( c ) ) {
374  return FLT_MAX;
375  }
376 
377  if( !smart ) {
378  return static_cast<int>( d );
379  }
380 
381  float power = c.power_rating();
382  monster *mon = dynamic_cast< monster * >( &c );
383  // Their attitude to us and not ours to them, so that bobcats won't get gunned down
384  if( mon != nullptr && mon->attitude_to( *this ) == Attitude::HOSTILE ) {
385  power += 2;
386  }
387 
388  if( power > 0 ) {
389  return static_cast<int>( d ) / power;
390  }

◆ refill_udders()

void monster::refill_udders ( )

Definition at line 613 of file monster.cpp.

614 {
615  if( type->starting_ammo.empty() ) {
616  debugmsg( "monster %s has no starting ammo to refill udders", get_name() );
617  return;
618  }
619  if( ammo.empty() ) {
620  // legacy animals got empty ammo map, fill them up now if needed.
621  ammo[type->starting_ammo.begin()->first] = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
622  }
623  auto current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk_raw );
624  if( current_milk == ammo.end() ) {
625  current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk );
626  if( current_milk != ammo.end() ) {
627  // take this opportunity to update milk udders to raw_milk
628  ammo[itype_milk_raw] = current_milk->second;
629  // Erase old key-value from map
630  ammo.erase( current_milk );
631  }
632  }
633  // if we got here, we got milk.
634  if( current_milk->second == type->starting_ammo.begin()->second ) {
635  // already full up
636  return;
637  }
638  if( !has_flag( mon_flag_EATS ) || has_effect( effect_critter_well_fed ) ) {
639  if( calendar::turn - udder_timer > 1_days ) {
640  // You milk once a day. Monsters with the EATS flag need to be well fed or they won't refill their udders.
641  ammo.begin()->second = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
642  udder_timer = calendar::turn;
643  }
644  }
645 }

◆ scent_move()

tripoint monster::scent_move ( )

Definition at line 1475 of file monmove.cpp.

1476 {
1477  // TODO: Remove when scentmap is 3D
1478  if( std::abs( posz() - get_map().get_abs_sub().z() ) > SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) {
1479  return { -1, -1, INT_MIN };
1480  }
1481  scent_map &scents = get_scent();
1482  bool in_range = scents.inbounds( pos() );
1483  if( !in_range ) {
1484  return { -1, -1, INT_MIN };
1485  }
1486 
1487  const std::set<scenttype_id> &tracked_scents = type->scents_tracked;
1488  const std::set<scenttype_id> &ignored_scents = type->scents_ignored;
1489 
1490  std::vector<tripoint> sdirection;
1491  std::vector<tripoint> smoves;
1492 
1493  int bestsmell = 10; // Squares with smell 0 are not eligible targets.
1494  int smell_threshold = 200; // Squares at or above this level are ineligible.
1495  if( has_flag( mon_flag_KEENNOSE ) ) {
1496  bestsmell = 1;
1497  smell_threshold = 400;
1498  }
1499 
1500  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1501  const bool fleeing = is_fleeing( player_character );
1502  int scent_here = scents.get_unsafe( pos() );
1503  if( fleeing ) {
1504  bestsmell = scent_here;
1505  }
1506 
1507  tripoint next( -1, -1, posz() );
1508  // Scent is too weak, can't follow it.
1509  if( scent_here == 0 ) {
1510  return next;
1511  }
1512  // Check for the scent type being compatible.
1513  const scenttype_id &type_scent = scents.get_type();
1514  bool right_scent = false;
1515  // is the monster tracking this scent
1516  if( !tracked_scents.empty() ) {
1517  right_scent = tracked_scents.find( type_scent ) != tracked_scents.end();
1518  }
1519  //is this scent recognised by the monster species
1520  if( !type_scent.is_empty() ) {
1521  const std::set<species_id> &receptive_species = type_scent->receptive_species;
1522  const std::set<species_id> &monster_species = type->species;
1523  std::vector<species_id> v_intersection;
1524  std::set_intersection( receptive_species.begin(), receptive_species.end(), monster_species.begin(),
1525  monster_species.end(), std::back_inserter( v_intersection ) );
1526  if( !v_intersection.empty() ) {
1527  right_scent = true;
1528  }
1529  }
1530  // is the monster actually ignoring this scent
1531  if( !ignored_scents.empty() && ( ignored_scents.find( type_scent ) != ignored_scents.end() ) ) {
1532  right_scent = false;
1533  }
1534  if( !right_scent ) {
1535  return { -1, -1, INT_MIN };
1536  }
1537 
1538  const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
1539  map &here = get_map();
1540  if( !fleeing && scent_here > smell_threshold ) {
1541  // Smell too strong to track, wander around
1542  sdirection.push_back( pos() );
1543  } else {
1544  // Get direction of scent
1545  for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) ) {
1546  int smell = scents.get( dest );
1547 
1548  if( ( !fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) ) {
1549  continue;
1550  }
1551  if( ( !fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) ) {
1552  sdirection.clear();
1553  sdirection.push_back( dest );
1554  bestsmell = smell;
1555  } else if( ( !fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) ) {
1556  sdirection.push_back( dest );
1557  }
1558  }
1559  }
1560 
1561  for( const tripoint &direction : sdirection ) {
1562  // Add some randomness to make creatures zigzag towards the source
1563  for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( direction, 1 ) ) {
1564  if( here.valid_move( pos(), dest, can_bash, true ) &&
1565  ( can_move_to( dest ) || ( dest == player_character.pos() ) ||
1566  ( can_bash && here.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), dest ) > 0 ) ) ) {
1567  smoves.push_back( dest );
1568  }
1569  }
1570  }
1571 
1572  return random_entry( smoves, next );
1573 }

2442  break;
2443  case creature_size::medium:

2459  }
2460  break;
2461  case creature_size::huge:
2462  if( veh_mass < 2000_kilogram ) {
2463  shove_moves_minimal = 50;
2464  shove_veh_mass_moves_factor = 4;
2465  shove_velocity = 1500;
2466  shove_damage_min = 0.00F;
2467  shove_damage_max = 0.05F;
2468  }
2469  break;
2470  default:
2471  break;
2472  }
2473  if( shove_velocity > 0 ) {
2474  //~ %1$s - monster name, %2$s - vehicle name
2475  add_msg_if_player_sees( this->pos(), m_bad, _( "%1$s shoves %2$s out of their way!" ),
2476  this->disp_name(),
2477  veh.disp_name() );
2478  int shove_moves = shove_veh_mass_moves_factor * veh_mass / 10_kilogram;
2479  shove_moves = std::max( shove_moves, shove_moves_minimal );
2480  this->mod_moves( -shove_moves );
2481  const tripoint destination_delta( -nearby_destination + remote_destination );
2482  const tripoint shove_destination( clamp( destination_delta.x, -1, 1 ),
2483  clamp( destination_delta.y, -1, 1 ),
2484  clamp( destination_delta.z, -1, 1 ) );

2486  veh.velocity = shove_velocity;
2487  if( shove_destination != tripoint_zero ) {
2488  if( shove_destination.z != 0 ) {
2489  veh.vertical_velocity = shove_destination.z < 0 ? -shove_velocity : +shove_velocity;
2490  }
2491  here.move_vehicle( veh, shove_destination, veh.face );
2492  }
2493  veh.move = tileray( destination_delta.xy() );
2494  veh.smash( here, shove_damage_min, shove_damage_max, 0.10F );
2495  }

◆ sight_range()

int monster::sight_range ( float  light_level) const
overridevirtual

How far the creature sees under the given light.

Creature cannot see places outside this range.

Parameters
light_levelSee game::light_level.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1285 of file monster.cpp.

1286 {
1287  // Non-aquatic monsters can't see much when submerged
1288  if( !can_see() || effect_cache[VISION_IMPAIRED] ||
1289  ( underwater && !swims() && !has_flag( mon_flag_AQUATIC ) && !digging() ) ) {
1290  return 1;
1291  }
1292  static const float default_daylight = default_daylight_level();
1293  if( light_level == 0 ) {
1294  return type->vision_night;
1295  } else if( light_level >= default_daylight ) {
1296  return type->vision_day;
1297  }

◆ try_reproduce()

void monster::try_reproduce ( )

Definition at line 547 of file monster.cpp.

548 {
549  if( !reproduces ) {
550  return;
551  }
552  // This can happen if the monster type has changed (from reproducing to non-reproducing monster)
553  if( !type->baby_timer ) {
554  return;
555  }
556 
557  if( !baby_timer && amount_eaten >= stomach_size ) {
558  // Assume this is a freshly spawned monster (because baby_timer is not set yet), set the point when it reproduce to somewhere in the future.
559  // Monsters need to have eaten eat to start their pregnancy timer, but that's all.
560  baby_timer.emplace( calendar::turn + *type->baby_timer );
561  }
562 
563  bool season_spawn = false;
564  bool season_match = true;
565 
566  // only 50% of animals should reproduce
567  bool female = one_in( 2 );
568  for( const std::string &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
569  if( elem == "SUMMER" || elem == "WINTER" || elem == "SPRING" || elem == "AUTUMN" ) {
570  season_spawn = true;
571  }
572  }
573 
574  map &here = get_map();
575  // add a decreasing chance of additional spawns when "catching up" an existing animal.
576  int chance = -1;
577  while( true ) {
578  if( !baby_timer.has_value() || *baby_timer > calendar::turn ) {
579  return;
580  }
581 
582  if( season_spawn ) {
583  season_match = false;
584  for( const std::string &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
585  if( ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
586  ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
587  ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
588  ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
589  season_match = true;
590  }
591  }
592  }
593 
594  chance += 2;
595  if( has_flag( mon_flag_EATS ) && has_effect( effect_critter_underfed ) ) {
596  chance += 1; //Reduce the chances but don't prevent birth if the animal is not eating.
597  }
598  if( season_match && female && one_in( chance ) ) {
599  int spawn_cnt = rng( 1, type->baby_count );
600  if( type->baby_monster ) {
601  here.add_spawn( type->baby_monster, spawn_cnt, pos_bub() );
602  } else {
603  const item egg( type->baby_egg, *baby_timer );
604  for( int i = 0; i < spawn_cnt; i++ ) {
605  here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), egg, true );
606  }
607  }
608  }
609  *baby_timer += *type->baby_timer;
610  }
611 }

◆ try_upgrade()

void monster::try_upgrade ( bool  pin_time)

Definition at line 451 of file monster.cpp.

452 {
453  if( !can_upgrade() ) {
454  return;
455  }
456 
457  const int current_day = to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero );
458  //This should only occur when a monster is created or upgraded to a new form
459  if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
460  upgrade_time = next_upgrade_time();
461  if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
462  return;
463  }
464  if( pin_time || type->age_grow > 0 ) {
465  // offset by today, always true for growing creatures
466  upgrade_time += current_day;
467  } else {
468  // offset by starting season
469  // TODO: revisit this and make it simpler
470  upgrade_time += to_days<int>( calendar::start_of_cataclysm - calendar::turn_zero );
471  }
472  }
473 
474  // Here we iterate until we either are before upgrade_time or can't upgrade any more.
475  // This is so that late into game new monsters can 'catch up' with all that half-life
476  // upgrades they'd get if we were simulating whole world.
477  while( true ) {
478  if( upgrade_time > current_day ) {
479  // not yet
480  return;
481  }
482 
483  if( type->upgrade_into ) {
484  //If we upgrade into a blacklisted monster, treat it as though we are non-upgradeable
485  if( MonsterGroupManager::monster_is_blacklisted( type->upgrade_into ) ) {
486  return;
487  }
488  poly( type->upgrade_into );
489  } else {
490  mtype_id new_type;
491  if( type->upgrade_multi_range ) {
492  bool ret_default = false;
493  std::vector<MonsterGroupResult> res = MonsterGroupManager::GetResultFromGroup(
494  type->upgrade_group, nullptr, nullptr, false, &ret_default );
495  if( !res.empty() && !ret_default ) {
496  // Set the type to poly the current monster (preserves inventory)
497  new_type = res.front().name;
498  res.front().pack_size--;
499  for( const MonsterGroupResult &mgr : res ) {
500  if( !mgr.name ) {
501  continue;
502  }
503  for( int i = 0; i < mgr.pack_size; i++ ) {
504  tripoint spawn_pos;
505  if( g->find_nearby_spawn_point( pos(), mgr.name, 1, *type->upgrade_multi_range,
506  spawn_pos, false, false ) ) {
507  monster *spawned = g->place_critter_at( mgr.name, spawn_pos );
508  if( spawned ) {
509  spawned->friendly = friendly;
510  }
511  }
512  }
513  }
514  }
515  } else {
516  new_type = MonsterGroupManager::GetRandomMonsterFromGroup( type->upgrade_group );
517  }
518  if( !new_type.is_empty() ) {
519  if( new_type ) {
520  poly( new_type );
521  } else {
522  // "upgrading" to mon_null
523  if( type->upgrade_null_despawn ) {
524  g->remove_zombie( *this );
525  } else {
526  die( nullptr );
527  }
528  return;
529  }
530  }
531  }
532 
533  if( !upgrades ) {
534  // upgraded into a non-upgradeable monster
535  return;
536  }
537 
538  const int next_upgrade = next_upgrade_time();
539  if( next_upgrade < 0 ) {
540  // hit never_upgrade
541  return;
542  }
543  upgrade_time += next_upgrade;
544  }
545 }

Definition: mongroup.cpp:389

◆ turns_to_reach()

int monster::turns_to_reach ( const point &  p)

Definition at line 2399 of file monmove.cpp.

2400 {
2401  map &here = get_map();
2402  // HACK: This function is a(n old) temporary hack that should soon be removed
2403  auto path = here.route( pos(), tripoint( p, posz() ), get_pathfinding_settings() );
2404  if( path.empty() ) {
2405  return 999;
2406  }
2407 
2408  double turns = 0.;
2409  for( size_t i = 0; i < path.size(); i++ ) {
2410  const tripoint &next = path[i];
2411  if( here.impassable( next ) ) {
2412  // No bashing through, it looks stupid when you go back and find
2413  // the doors intact.
2414  return 999;
2415  } else if( i == 0 ) {
2416  turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( pos(), next ) ) / get_speed();
2417  } else {
2418  turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( path[i - 1], next ) ) / get_speed();
2419  }
2420  }
2421 
2422  return static_cast<int>( turns + .9 ); // Halve (to get turns) and round up
2423 }

References calc_movecost(), get_map(), get_pathfinding_settings(), Creature::get_speed(), map::impassable(), path, Creature::pos(), Creature::posz(), map::route(), and tripoint.

Set p as wander destination.

This will cause the monster to slowly move towards the destination, unless there is an overriding smell or plan.
